loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is a 27-year-old mother and is married with three children, who are dependents and are still in school.  She has been a farmer in a village in the Moung Russey district for more than 15 years, supplementing her income by catching fish to sell. 

A leader of a group with four members, San has been with VisionFund since 2005, while her group members have been with VisionFund for between 1 and 4 years. Previous loans from VisionFund have helped San send her children to school regularly. She is now requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice paddy farming for 350 U.S. dollars. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ball Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ball Group in Western Kenya! Betina is the facilitator of the Ball group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Betina takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Betina had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Betina was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Betina  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Betina will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ball group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Betina and her group with the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

Jane takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a very good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jane will educate her children and ensure food security for her family.
 
In 2012, the members of Chekalini Central group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Jane with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings to construct rental houses. The construction has started. The only challenge is that she needs to buy more building materials to complete the houses. Hence she has requested loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy more building materials.
Florence hopes to succeed in her business so as to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Bert

texts.en:
Everybody dreams to have a happy family and successful lifestyle. But for some of us this remains a dream. But Bert, a 39-year-old farmer, dreams to experience a comfortable life with his wife and two children and persists to achieve that dream. So he asks for financial assistance through asking for a loan amount of P20,000 to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow his business.

He hopes that his business will grow accordingly to become a practicable source of income. Through this, he could lift his family from poverty and achieve his dream.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow his business.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is a 27-year-old mother who is married and has two children who are dependents and still in school.

She has been a farmer in a village of the Ponhea Krek district all her life. She supplements the income of her husband by producing palm sugar. With her current business, she earns less than 15 US dollars per day. 

Neang leads a group of two female members and she is a third-cycle client who has been with VisionFund since 2009, while her group member has been with VisionFund since 2010. 

Neang completely repaid the previous loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund helped her to have a regular income and send her children to school. 

Now she is requesting a loan and she will use this loan to buy bamboo to make ladders for climbing palm sugar trees. With this loan, she hopes to produce more palm sugar and earn more income to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to make ladders for climbing palm sugar trees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Namushiya B Group

texts.en:
Margaret is the facilitator of the Namushiya B group. Margaret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Margaret takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Margaret had a good maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Margaret was only able to harvest one bag of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margaret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Margaret will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Namushiya B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Margaret is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sahobiddin

texts.ru: Сахобиддин узнав о возможности получения кредита на расширение животноводства решил тоже получить займ и купить пару молодых коров.Он отец пятерых детей, сам по профессии электрик, но его доходы не хватают на прожиточный минимум , поэтому он занимается скотоводством.Сахобиддин получив кредит искренне благодарен за понимание и финансирование сельской местности.
texts.en: Having learned about an opportunity to obtain a loan to expand his animal husbandry business, Sahobiddin decided to also obtain a loan and purchase a pair of young cows.  He is a father of five children and is an electrician by trade, but his income is not sufficient to cover the cost of living.  This is why he is involved in animal husbandry.  Having obtained the loan, Sahobiddin is genuinely grateful for the understanding and financing for the local rural residents.

loans.use: to purchase two young cows

In the recent 2011 season,Stephen had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Stephen was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Stephen will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Umurzok

texts.ru: Умурзок мужчина 35 лет, женат, имеет пятерых детей. Сам по специальности мастер строитель и дополнительно к этому он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него много голов мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить количество скота. Жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей и заодно помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Умурзок с детства помогал отцу по уходу за скотом, поэтому у него есть опыт в этом бизнесе. Он рад, что имеет возможность получить кредит и сотрудничеству с нами.
texts.en: Umurzok is a 35 year-old married man, who has five children.  He is a construction foreman by trade and is also involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Currently, he owns many heads of small livestock.  Umurzok wants to use this loan to increase his livestock quantity.  His wife is a homemaker and is involved in raising the children, and also helps Umurzok with caring for the livestock.  Since childhood, Umurzok helped his father with caring for livestock, and this is why he has experience in this business.  He is happy that he has the opportunity to obtain this loan and partner with us.

loans.use: to increase livestock quantity

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim is 30 years old, a factory worker who comes from Ang Snoul district. 

His work schedule starts at 7 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m.. This type of work is extremely related to his physical state. Anyway, he has to do it for his living. From this business, he is able to generate an income $8 per day. Chhim has a life partner in his wife, who is on a sewing staff, and he is blessed with two children. Both of his children are attending a local school. 

With the sum of $1,200, he will build a small brick house and cover the roof with zinc. This house will provide a comfortable living for his family. He would like to say thanks to all lenders who lend him money to build this shelter.

loans.use: to a build a small brick house and cover the roof with zinc.

loans.name: Durawall South Group

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Maria, a single mother of two from Machipisa Harare. One of her children is still at  school.  

She runs a manufacturing business, producing peanut butter that she supplies to her local community. The business has been in operation for three years. Maria says the main challenge is stiff competition from well-established companies. 

She has requested a loan of $400 to purchase peanuts and packaging containers. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family and other community member though employing them. 

In the future, Maria plans to beat those established companies by manufacturing good and tasty products.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and packaging containers for peanut butter.

loans.name: K Ndege A Group

texts.en:

Edward takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Edward had a good maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edward was only able to harvest 3½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edward and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edward will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of K Ndege A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Edward is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the tailoring industry for the last six years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 57 years old, married to Mary, and they have three children who are in secondary school.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more cloth fabric to make dresses.

The anticipated profits he will save and purchase a modern sewing machine. John hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy cloth fabric for making dresses.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is a 25-year-old married lady with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

Her business is a restaurant that she started with 200,000 UGX only and has been running for eight years. The major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock. 

However, she has goals of buying land to grow crops and expanding the business into new areas.

The purpose of the loan is to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Holikberdi

texts.ru: Холикберди мужчина 48 лет,отец единственного сына, проживает в одном из отдаленных сел. С детства занимается откормом и продажей скота.Кроме откорма скота у него специальность ветеринара и он хорошо разбирается в заболеваниях скота. Его услугами пользуются многие односельчане. Его жена также занимается обработкой козьей шерсти, что приносит дополнительный доход для семьи.На получаемый кредит Умурзок хочет купить две дойные коровы, а также запасти корм для них.
texts.en: Holikberdi is a 48 year-old man and a father of only son.  He lives in one of the remote villages.  Holikberdi has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock since childhood.  Besides fattening up livestock, he is a veterinarian and is very knowledgeable about livestock diseases.  Many of his village residents use his veterinary services.  Holikberdi's wife is also involved in processing goat hair, which brings in an additional income for the family.  Holikberdi wants to use this loan to purchase two dairy cows and stock up on livestock feed.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and stock up on livestock feed

loans.name: Minyali Fc Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Minyali FC Group in Western Kenya! Susan is the facilitator of the Minyali FC group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Susan takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Susan had a good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Susan was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Susan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Susan will educate her children.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Mary will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Mutoma W G group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Mary with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Собир кредитуется в организации уже четвёртый год. Ему 39 лет, он отец троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка и помогает Собиру ухаживать за скотом. Собир кроме откорма скота имеет свой ларёк по продаже говяжьего мяса. Убой скота он делает сам. Получаемых доходов вполне хватает на жизнь семьи, поэтому он благодарен нашей организации за предоставленную возможность ему расширить свой бизнес. За четыре года кредитования он на разу не нарушил условия погашения кредита, поэтому организация с полной уверенностью выдает ему очередной кредит.
texts.en: Sobir has been obtaining financing from our organization for the fourth year now.  He is 39 years old and is a father of three children.  His wife is a homemaker and helps Sobir with caring for livestock.  Besides fattening up livestock, Sobir has a retail stand, where he sells beef.  He himself butchers the livestock.  Received income is quite sufficient to support the family, and this is why he is grateful to our organization for the provided opportunity for him to expand his business.  Sobir has not once violated the loan repayment terms throughout the four years of financing, and this is why the organization provides him with this next loan with full assurance.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Joyce Grace

texts.en:
Joyce Grace is 35 years old, married and has two children. She's from Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Joyce Grace owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products. She has been one year in this business and she earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Joyce Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Joyce Grace is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Iem

texts.en:
Iem has spent most of her life cultivating rice crops alongside her husband in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. She is now 60 years old, a window, and lives together with two single children who always assist in her farming work. She typically yields an income in the neighborhood of $1.50 per day to cover her daily expenses. 

The reason that she borrows this loan from HKL is that the family has difficulties in traveling by taking motor-taxi services. Therefore, she decided to ask for some funds to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the family in order to reduce expenses by avoiding taking motor-taxi services. With the rest of this fund, she will buy a new wheel for the plowing machine to replace the one that was broken.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the family.

loans.name: Omurbek

texts.ru:
Омурбек родился в селе Панфиловское (Панфиловский район, Чуйская обл., Кыргызская Республика). Омурбек вырос в большой семье, у него 3 брата и 3 сестры, родители были простыми рабочими.  После окончания школы Омурбек поступил в училище, получив специальность тракториста, помогал семье по хозяйству. В 1985 году Омурбек женился и остался жить со своими родителями, где основным источником дохода семьи являлось разведение скотины и полеводство. В 1989 году родилась первая дочь, а в 1995 году у Омурбека родилась вторая дочь. Проработав в родном колхозе 3 года, он решает заняться своим делом. Стартовые сбережения его семьи составляли 10,000 сом (KGS), на которые решено было начать разведение скота, купив для начала одну корову. Были тяжелые времена, семья к концу 90х годов состояла уже из 6 человек, детей нужно было одеть, обуть, супруга была дома, занималась домашними хлопотами.  С развалом Советского Союза колхоза уже не стало, заработанных денег еле хватало на еду. И вот тогда Омурбек решает заняться и полеводством, начав с собственного огорода, где он начал выращивать свеклу. Полученный урожай Омурбек стал сдавать на сахарный завод, а на вырученные деньги - закупать скот. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Омурбека  2 дойные коровы, 2 телочки и 1 бычок, также, в сезон,  он предоставляет услуги тракториста местному населению.  По хозяйству ему помогает жена, супруги воспитывают пятерых детей – двое из них студенты, трое – школьники. Сам Омурбек не только хороший человек, но и замечательный, любящий отец и муж. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Омурбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партанеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Омурбек мечтает в будущем развить свою ферму и купить новую технику.
texts.en:
Omburek was born in the Panfilov village, of the Chuy region in Kyrgystan. He grew up in a very large family, with 3 sisters and 3 brothers while his parents were simple workers. After finishing high school Omburek was trained as a tractor driver and helped his parents with their farm. In 1985 Omburek  married and chose to remain living with his parents who were raising cattle and farming at the time. His first daughter was born in 1985 and in 1995 Omburek became a father of a second girl. After working with the community farm (kolhoz) for three years Omburek decided to start his own farm. He used a starting sum of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow and start his cattle raising business. At first Omburek has fallen on hard times, as towards the end of the 90s his family grew to six people and he was struggling to provide for clothing and shoes, while his wife had to stay home and take care of the little ones. After the fall of the Soviet Union his community farm fell apart and the money Omburek was making was barely enough to purchase food for everyone. At that time Omburek decided to also start farming, and began growing sugar beets at his house plot. He was selling his harvest to the local sugar factory and using the profits to purchase more livestock. Now Omburek's household has flourished and he owns two milk cows, two heifers and a calf and he also offers his tractor driving skills during the planting season to the other local farmers. His wife is now able to help a lot more with the farm as two of his five children are already in college while the youngest three are all attending school. Omburek himself is not only a good businessman but also a wonderful loving husband and father.

In order to further expand his livestock business and purchase more animals, Omburek has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). In the future Omburek dreams of expanding his farm as well and buying new farming equipment for himself.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Leparakuo

texts.en:
Leparakuo, who is a livestock farmer, had previously serviced a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings which he used to buy sheep. He was able to make a good sale. He has now become more focused in his business and he hopes to grow his clientele.

Leparakuo has requested for another loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Mwichinga B Group

Benjamin is the facilitator of the Mwichinga B group. Benjamin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benjamin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In the recent 2011 season, Benjamin had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benjamin was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Benjamin will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Mwichinga B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Benjamin with his group members.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin is in the business of cultivating rice crops in Ang Snoul district, Cambodia. She is able to earn an average of $3 per day to cover household expenses. 

She is married and has four children, two of whom work for garment factories and get monthly payments. One among them is already married and has started a new family. 

The purpose of this loan is to expand her present house and fix some broken parts. She will spend around $600 to get her house repaired. She hopes to have a better living through using the loan from HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: to expand her present house and fix some broken parts.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old and a single-mother of a two-year-old. She sells natural medicines and health products. She has been in the business for one year.  She also has an electronic shop where she earns extra income.She works hard in her business so as to provide for her child.

Being a new member of Faulu Kenya, Agnes believes that the company will help her to boost her business because she is able to access business loans easily. Agnes has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy natural medicines and health products.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and health products.

loans.name: Goorgoorlu Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 22 JUILLET 2003. Il  est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de poulets de chaire. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de payer ses dettes et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Goorgoorlu solidarity group was formed on July 22nd, 2003. It is made up of 13 women who all live in the same area and are all traders.

Fatoumata, standing on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group´s leader. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She is an experienced saleswoman who has sold broiler chickens (chickens raised specifically for meat production) for several years.

This loan will increase Fatoumata´s working capital and will allow her to buy some chicks and increase her business activity. She will use her profits to pay off her debts and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy broiler chicks.

loans.name: Wekhonya Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wekhonya Group in Western Kenya! Deborah is the facilitator of the Wekhonya group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Deborah takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Deborah had a good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Deborah was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Deborah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Deborah will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Wekhonya Group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His family goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house and buy a car. 

He has been practicing commercial farming for six years. His major hardships are price fluctuation, high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a dream of buying land to grow crops, hiring employees to help expand the business and moving the business to more permanent location.

Wilson needs another loan to plant more coffee.

loans.use: to plant more coffee.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som is 46 years old and a single parent living with four children in Kompong Speu province. 

To earn a living, she grows rice crops in the rainy season but the profit is barely able to cover her daily cost. Therefore, all of children decided to help their mother in earning income by working in various careers. Three of her sons are now working together with a construction team that travels from place to place, while the daughter is on a sewing staff in a garment factory. 

With the loan of $1,000,  Som will buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family. She hopes that with it, her children can get to work easily without taking the motor-taxi service as in the old time.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for the family.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de 12 membres qui font toutes le petit commerce comme activité principale.

Seynbou (debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans et mère d'un enfant. 

Seynabou s'active dans le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et d'ustensiles de cuisine.

Elle achète sa marchandise dans la capitale et revend dans son quartier. et ce crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement. 

Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
This group was created on 28 March 2008. It has twelve members who all run small businesses as their main activity. Seynabou (standing up at the far right of the photo) is the group leader. She is 53 years old and the mother of one child.
 
Seynabou runs a small business selling cosmetic products and kitchen utensils. She buys her products in the capital and resells them in her neighbourhood, and this loan will allow her to increase her stock. The profits from her business will help her provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a farmer in the Philippines who operates a farming business as a source of income. He also engages in the poultry-raising business to generate additional income. He is 40 years old and supports his wife and five children through these businesses. He aims to improve his living and increase his income to satisfy his family's needs, especially the educational needs of his children.

Rufino is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use in developing his farming business. Hopefully, the loan will help grow his business and help him lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use in developing his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 35 years old, married and has four children. To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has been in the business for eleven years.  He also does poultry farming to supplement his family's income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been trained on business management.

Moses hopes to grow his business so he can get a good income to provide a quality education to his children.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.

Willy has been running a retail shop for five years since changing careers from his previous work as a bicycle mechanic. He has a vision of owning a big retail shop with many products, but he has insufficient capital. Willy is requesting a loan to buy soap, sugar, and millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and millet to sell.

loans.name: Kibeu B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kibeu B Group in Western Kenya! Yunia is the facilitator of the Kibeu B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Yunia takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Yunia had an excellent maize yield harvesting 36 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Yunia was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Yunia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Yunia will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Kibeu B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard has been supplying household items to the small shops in Ruaka for the last five years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 26 years old, married to Mary, and the father of one child.

Leonard is applying for his first loan, in the amount of KES 30,000, from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to add stocks of sweets and soaps to sell wholesale.

He hopes to save any additional profits to open a storefront from which he will sell his goods. Leonard hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Miyuke B Group

texts.en:
Alfred is the facilitator of the Miyuke B group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alfred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Albert was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Miyuke B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Alfred is pictured with his group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a business-lady who runs a boutique to earn a living.  She has been in the business for two years.
  
Winnie, who is a single mother of a two-year-old child, works hard in her business so as to provide for her child.

Winnie desires to expand her business in five years for more income generation.  She has requested 
80,000 Kenya shillings to buy beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Sànt Yàlla Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée le 28/03/2008. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même localité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou Dame  debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée mère d'un enfant. 

Elle dispose d'une table où elle vend tous les matins le petit déjeuner. Elle dispose d'une forte expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en lait, sucre, café, beurre pain etc pour mener à bien son activité de vente de petit déjeuné.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created on 28 March 2008. It has 11 members who all come from the same area. They all run small businesses as their main activity. Fatou Dame (holding up her hand at the far right of the photo) is the group leader. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child.

She has a stall where she sells breakfast every morning. She has a lot of experience in this business as she has been doing this for several years. This loan will allow her to buy milk, sugar, coffee, butter, bread and other supplies to make her breakfast business a success.

Her aim is to help her husband support the family while increasing his savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, coffee, bread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kriel

texts.en:
Kriel is a skillful basket-weaver who lives in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. Along with baskets, she makes other containers and objects by weaving thin strips of wood or bamboo. She learned this skill from her parents, and she typically earns approximately $4.00 per day by selling to the traders who regularly visit her home to purchase her wares. Kriel is 29 years old and has a common-law husband who is a driver.

Kriel is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so he can commute to his workplace. This will help to reduce their expenses, enabling her to save more money in hopes of achieving her dream: to have a store for selling her handmade products in the neighboring country of Thailand.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband's commute.

loans.name: Njenda Kalaa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njenda Kalaa Group in Western Kenya! Lydia is the facilitator of the Njenda Kalaa group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Lydia takes care of 12 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lydia had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lydia was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lydia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Lydia will educate her children and repair home.

In 2012, the members of Njenda Kalaa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single mother of two children, aged 27 and 29.  To earn a living, she runs a pub. She has operated the business for six years.  She has built a good relationship with her customers.  This has helped her to grow her clientele.  She also does dairy farming to supplement her income.

Lucy hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy beer and soda.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda.

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Jubbo a été crée depuis l'ouverture du banc villageois. Il compte 15 femmes et qui habitent pour la plupart dans le même village.

Daba,debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 06 enfants.	
	
Son prêt reçu lui permettra de mieux développer son petit commerce de mil, de l'huile et de l'arachide. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.	
	
Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter son niveau d'épargnes et participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vies de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Juboo solidarity group was set up after the opening of the banc villageois. The group has 15 women members, most of whom live in the same village.

Daba, standing on the right in the photo, is head of the group. She is 47 years old and married, with six children.
	
Her loan will allow her to develop her small business selling millet, oil and groundnuts. She has been working in this field of activity for many years, which has given her a lot of experience.
	
The profits from the business will allow her to increase her savings and improve her children's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy millet, groundnuts and other supplies.

loans.name: Mulwanda C Group

texts.en:
Janepher is the facilitator of the Mulwanda C group. Janepher and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janepher and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Janepher takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Janepher had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land.

Before joining One Acre Fund, Janepher was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Janepher will invest in livestock rearing and buy more land as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Mulwanda C group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Janepher is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kitintali in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past five years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food products for resale, and it will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop.

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of cereals and pay for transport to the market.

loans.name: Katosia Group

texts.en:
Ben is the facilitator of the Katosia group. Ben and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Ben takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Ben had a very good maize yield harvesting 17 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ben was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Ben will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Katosia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Ben is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Tum, 43, a mother of three single children, owns a business selling a variety of products from a booth at her house. She sells many things, such as sweets, soft drinks, biscuits, shampoos, and powders and other household products for the people in her community. She typically earns approximately $1.50 per day. Tum’s husband is a garment factory worker in Kampong Chhnang province. Tum wants to further help her family by producing palm juice from sugar palm trees. She need funds from Kiva to invest in this project. For this reason, she is taking out a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to buy a ladder for climbing sugar palm trees and bamboo containers for sugar palm juice as well. She is very pleased and appreciative to all lenders who kindly help in her business.

loans.use: to buy a ladder for climbing sugar palm trees and bamboo containers for sugar palm juice.

loans.name: Khasiro Group

texts.en:
Benson is the facilitator of the Khasiro group. Benson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benson takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest six bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khasiro group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Niankh Jarinu Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis 28 mars 2008. Il est composé de onze femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce

Aida (debout à droite de la photo)est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de produits cosmétiques. 

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en s'approvisionnant en quantité plus importante de produits cosmétiques.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group has existed since 28 March 2008. It is made up of 11 women who are all from the same neighbourhood. Small-scale business is their main activity. 

Aida (standing at the right of the photo) is head of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children. She sells cosmetics. 

Her loan will help her strengthen her business by buying a larger quantity of cosmetic products.

The profits generated will allow her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao is 48 years old and a loving father of eight children. It’s quite a big family, so Sao has to try hard in his farming work to be able to raise his children. His current profits can’t satisfy his family’s needs. In order to solve this living condition, he decided to start another business, collecting and selling firewood throughout the community. And now he is looking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to buy two buffaloes for use in his new business.

loans.use: to buy two buffaloes for use in his new firewood business.

loans.name: Mpayo

texts.en:
Mpayo is 25 years old, married, and has three children.  He practices livestock farming.  He has been in the business for eight years. The climate of his area is favorable for farming and he has enough grazing land.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business with his previous loan.

Mpayo hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years.  He has requested  40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Moushira

texts.en:
Moushira is a 27-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. In order to pay their children's education fees, Moushira and her husband strive to work really hard. And for that reason, Mourshira decided to start her own business. She opened her own clothing shop in 2008. Her husband has been also working in his own women's clothing store for the past ten years. 

Today, Moushira is looking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, in order to purchase the new winter collection of clothes. She notes that this will increase her business sales, especially during the holidays. In the future, she plans to open other branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Diamaguene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diamaguene  a été crée le 17-04-2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité qui est le commerce de détails.		

Madame Fatou Mac (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle a aussi en charge 6 enfants de sa coépouse . 

Elle développe un petit commerce d'arachides, de mil et d'huile. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années. 
		
Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en arachide, du mil et de l'huile pour revendre.	
	
Ses recettes lui permettront d'aider son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The Diamaguene solidarity group was set up on the 17 April 2010. It is made up of 12 women who are all from the same area. They are all active in the retail business.	

Fatou Mac (standing on the right of the photo) is the group leader. She is 41 years old and married, with 9 children. She also supports the six children of her co-spouse. 

She has a small business selling groundnuts, millet and oil. She has much experience in this activity as she has been in the business for many years.
		
With her loan, she will increase her supplies of groundnuts, millet and oil for reselling.
	
Her income will allow her to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, oil and millet.

loans.name: Fass Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fass Diom compte 5 femmes; il a été crée le 20-04-2010. Les femmes qui le composent sont de la même localité et font du commerce de détails.
Âgée de 41 ans, la responsable du groupe madame Tening est debout a droite de la photo et levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.
Son prêt reçu va lui permettre d'acheter des brebis, qu'elle va engraisser et revendre. Une activité qu'elle fait depuis toujours ce qui fait son expérience.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie des sa famille.
texts.en:
The group Fass Diom is comprised of five women; it was created on April 20, 2010. The women in the group are from the same town and are retail merchants. 

At 41 years of age, the group’s official, Ms. Tening, is the one in the photo standing at the right with her hand raised. She is married and the mother of seven children. 

The loan obtained is going to enable her to buy some sheep, which she will fatten and then sell. This is a business that she has always operated and that composes her experience. 

The profits will serve to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Mulwanda B Group

texts.en:
Alice is the facilitator of the Mulwanda B group. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Alice will invest in livestock rearing and send her children to school.

In 2012, the members of Mulwanda B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of cosmetics, as well as chemical relaxers, shampoo, braids and wigs for sale.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Group in Western Kenya! Electine is the facilitator of the Bidii group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Electine takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Electine had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Electine was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Electine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Electine will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 31 years old and single. She owns a food stall in a competitive environment.  But she has retained her customers because she prepares very delicious meals.  

She started her business eight years ago after college.  She has improved the business because she has been trained in business management.

Dorcas has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as rice and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha is a 57-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and their five children who are still attending school. She coordinates with her husband to satisfy the family needs. Aysha had ten years of experience in selling electronics supplies and satellites, before deciding to open her own shop in 2006. As for her husband’s job, it consists of installing satellites upon customers’ requests. Today, Aysha is asking for a loan of $2,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added equipment for her business, such as satellites, mixers, refrigerators and many other items, in order to increase her revenue. In the future, she plans to expand her shop by adding diverse electrical items.

loans.use: to purchase added equipment, such as satellites, mixers, refrigerators and many other items, for her business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has grown her business after servicing a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings.  She used the loan to buy body lotion, nail polish, and oils.  With the additional stock, she made good sales.  

Hellen has used the additional profit from her business to start a business of selling mobile phone credit cards.

She has requested another loan of 45,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair oil and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy hair oil and hair treatments.

loans.name: Sanabarkhon

texts.ru: Санабархон 60 лет, вдова. Санабархон воспитала пятерых детей, часть из которых уехала на заработки в Россию. Санабархон в течении 20 лет работала старшей медсестрой, сейчас находится на пенсии, получая пособие в 2,800 сом (KGS).  В связи с тем, что заработная плата медицинских работников низкая, в 2000 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, Санабархон начала заниматься перепродажей бывших в употреблении вещей, таких как старые телевизоры, кровати, холодильники и т.д. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Санабархон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS).   Доходы от кредита Санабархон планирует направить на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Sanabarkhon is 60 years old and a widow. She had raised five children who have mostly left to Russia for work. Sanabarkhon had been working for twenty years as chief nurse in the local hospital and now is in retirement. Her pension is 2,800 som (KGS) monthly, which is about $60. Since the salary of medical workers in Kyrgystan is low, Sanabarkhon had started a second hand resale store back in 2000. She sells used TVs, rugs, refrigerators and the like. To further expand her second hand business Sanabarkhon has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which she will use to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to raise floating capital

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 35-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and child. He’s their only support and they trust he can provide for all of their needs. He started to work as a farmer in 2008, after being involved in the agricultural field for five years. He loves his work and is willing to make sacrifices in order to get a good harvest. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy seeds and fertilizers for his land. This Kiva loan will certainly boost his productivity, thus boosting his earnings. In the future, he plans to buy new land and increase his productivity in fruit and vegetable farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Chegulo Central Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chegulo Central Group in Western Kenya! Lenah is the facilitator of Chegulo Central group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Lenah takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lenah had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lenah was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lenah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Lenah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Chegulo Central group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fass Diom Taku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fass Diom Taku Ligueye, a été crée depuis l'ouverture du Banc villageois. Il est composé de 05 femmes de la méme localité. Elle font du commerce de divers produits.
La présidente du groupe Aissatou âgée de 44 ans est debout à droite sur la photo et levant la main. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter du mil et du "bissap" pour revendre au marché du village. Elle a de l'expérience dans ce domaine d'activité car elle le fait depuis des années et y trouve son compte.
Ainsi avec les recettes de sa vente, elle va renforcer ses épargnes et refaire sa maison.
texts.en: The Fass Diom Taku Ligueye group was created at the inauguration of the banc villageois. It is comprised of five women who live in the same area. They sell miscellaneous products. The president of the group, Aissatou, who is 44 years old, is standing to the right of the photo, raising her hand. She is a married mother of six. With the loan, she will buy millet and hibiscus flowers (used to flavor beverages) to sell at the village market. She has years of experience in this business and relies on the income it brings. With the earnings, she will save and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy millet and hibiscus flowers (used to flavor beverages)

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Ann is the facilitator of the Ebenezer group. Ann and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ann and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ann had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ann was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Ann will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Ebenezer group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Ann with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, 30, is married and a mother of four children.  She has been running a retail shop for five years.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because of financial support.  For extra income, she does farming.  She works hard in her business so as to provide for her children good education.

She hopes to grow her business for more income generation in the future.  She needs a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам женат, имеет 3-х детей. Раньше работал в вата-чесальном цеху, но от этого цеха прибыли было мало. Он решил закрыть это дело и заняться откормом скота. У него дома тогда было 2 коровы. Корова каждый день давала до 20 литров молока и соседи покупали у него молочные продукты, а внуки каждый день завтракали  только молочными продуктами. За коров ему предлагали большую сумму, но он не хотел продавать, так как это являлось основным доходом.  Узнав в 2007 году о нашей организации получил у нас кредит приобрел еще одного быка. Вскоре он начал размножать свой скот и продавать его. За период сотрудничества в течении 4 лет, он арендовал за пределами города участок земли и приобрел еще 2 коров и 2 быков. Все лето он  провел на этом участке земли и за стоимость каждого проданного скота сажал на этом участке земли редьку и морковь, а сейчас продает урожай. В зимний период скот дешевле, чем в теплую погоду, поэтому на полученный кредит он собирается купить еще 4 коров. Сейчас он и его семья благодарны кредиторам за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Uktam is married and has three children.  He previously worked at a cotton-ball processing facility, but his profit there was low.  He decided to close that business and get involved in fattening up livestock.  He has two cows at that time.  Each cow produced up to 20 liters of milk daily, and neighbors bought dairy products from Uktam, and his grandsons had only dairy products for breakfast.  Uktam was offered a large amount of money for his cows, but he did not want to sell because this was his main source of income.  Having learned about our organization in 2007, Uktam obtained a loan from us and purchased one more bull.  Soon after, he started to breed and sell livestock.  Throughout the four-year partnership, he leased a plot of land outside the town and purchased two more cows and two more bulls.  He spent the entire summer on that land and planted radish and carrots there, using the money from each sold livestock.  And now, he sells his harvest.  Livestock is cheaper during winter than during warm seasons, and this is why Uktam plans to use this loan to purchase four more cows.  Currently, he and his family are grateful to the creditors for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou a été crée le 20 avril 2010. Il compte 8 femmes toutes issues de la même localité et exerçant la même activité.
La responsable du groupe ,madame Tening,debout à droite de la photo et levant la main,est agéé de 39 ans. Elle mariée et mére de 04 enfants.
Son pret recu lui permettra de vendre du poisson et des fruits(oranges, mangues), selon la période. Elle est très expérimentée dans la vente pour l'avoir fait pendant plusieurs années.
Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et assure une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou solidarity group was set up on April 20 2010. The group is made up of 8 women all from the same area and working in the same business. 

The group's leader, Madame Tening, standing at right with her hand raised,  is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her loan will allow her to sell fish and fruit (oranges and mangoes) depending on the season. She has been selling for several years and has plenty of experience. The profit she makes will allow her to improve her living conditions and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish and fruit.

loans.name: Mama Safi Netondo Group

texts.en:
Simon is the facilitator of the Mama Safi Netondo group. Simon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Simon takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had a good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Simon was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Simon will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mama Safi Netondo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 11 JUILLET 2002. Il  est composé de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Bintou. qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et de poulet de chaire. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ces domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: This solidarity group was founded on July 11, 2002.  It is made up of thirteen women who live in this same neighborhood and whose main professional activity is retail business.  Bintou is the facilitator of the group.  In the picture, she is the woman standing on the right with her hand raised.  Bintou is 54 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Bintou works very hard:  she sells fabrics and meat chickens.  She has been pursuing these activities for several years now and has become quite proficient at her trade.   The loan she is requesting will allow her to increase her capital and to further develop her business.  The profits will allow Bintou to increase her savings and will improve her family's living conditions (in terms of health, food, clothes etc...).

loans.use: To buy fabrics and young chickens

loans.name: Soforal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 11 JUILLET 2002. Il  est  composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Sarata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 71 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de la patte d'arachide. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Soforal solidarity group was created on July the 11th, 2002. It is made up of 8 woman who all live in the same area and are all small retailers.

Sarata, standing on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group´s leader. She is 71 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She is an experienced saleswoman who has been selling peanut butter for many years.

This loan will increase Sarata´s working capital and will allow her to restock and develop her business activity. She will use her profits to improve her family´s living conditions - by buying good food and clothes and paying medical bills - and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Bokk Xoll Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 11 7 2002. Il  est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Oulimata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants mais a  en charge un  enfant qui lui est confié par ses proches.

Elle s’active dans la vente de "nététou" (un produit alimentaire local) Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Bokk Xoll solidarity group was created on the 11th of July, 2002. It is made up of 8 woman who all live in the same area and are all small retailers.

Oulimata, standing on the right of the picture with her hand raised, is the group´s leader. She is 62 years old and widowed. She has no children of her own, but is raising a child put in her care by her family. She is an experienced saleswoman who has been selling "nététou" (a local dish) for many years.

This loan will increase Oulimata´s working capital and allow her to restock and develop her business activity. She will use her profits to improve her family´s living conditions - by buying good food and clothes and paying medical bills - and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy nététou for resale.

loans.name: Namushiya Joint Group

texts.en:
Annah is the facilitator of the Namushiya Joint group. Annah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Annah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Annah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Annah had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Annah was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Annah will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Namushiya Joint group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Annah is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tushirikiane B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tushirikiane B Group in Western Kenya! Daina is the facilitator of Tushirikiane B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Daina takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Daina had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Daina was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Daina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Daina will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Tushirikiane B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mamadou Mansour

texts.fr:
Mamadou Mansour  est  un jeune aviculteur  âgé  de  31 ans qui a démarré son activité depuis  2008.Il est  célibataire  sans enfant.
Son activité consiste à élever des poulets de chair ; métier qu’il adore car l’ayant démarré dès le jeune âge.
Le prêt lui servira acheter de l’aliment volaille pour ne pas être en rupture et avoir de bons sujets.
Mamadou pourra avec ses revenus subvenir à ses besoins et renforcer son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Mamadou Mansour is 31 years old, single and has no children. He is a poultry farmer and started a business raising broiler chickens (chickens raised specifically for meat production) in 2008. He loves his work, which he started at a very early age.

Mamadou Mansour will use this loan to restock on chicken feed so that he can raise healthy chickens. He will use the income from his business to take care of his needs and strengthen his working capital.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Sehoachi

texts.fr:
Sehoachi est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé dans une société de la place. Elle a 03 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 12ans et le dernier 05ans.
Sehoachi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale depuis 2006. Elle vend à la maison à ses clients. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Sehoachi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Sehoachi voudrait ouvrir une deuxième boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarité et le bien être des enfants.
texts.en: Sehoachi is a 39 year old woman.  She is married to an employee of a local company.  She has three children who are all in school.  The eldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 5 years old.  Sehoachi has worked as a general food retailer since 2006.  She sells to her clients from her home.  She purchases her products in Lomé.  Sehoachi has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to purchase general food products.  She wants to re-invest in her business with the profits she makes.  In the next few years, Sehoachi would like to open a second shop.  She says that with the profits, she plans to provide for the education and well-being of her children.

loans.use: to purchase general food products.

loans.name: Agossi

texts.fr:
Agossi est une femme  âgé(e) de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a 02 enfants tous  à l’école. Le premier a 18 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.
