Agossi travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et du maïs depuis 1999. Elle vend  seule à ses clients à la maison et n’a aucune difficulté principale. 
Agossi a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et du maïs. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Agossi voudrait améliorer le niveau de  l’activité en ajoutant d’autres choses. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’entretenir les enfants et améliorer leur niveau d’étude.
texts.en: Agossi is a 46 year old woman.  She is married to a mechanic.  She has two children who are both in school.  The first is 18 years old and the second is 12.  Agossi has worked as a charcoal and corn retailer since 1999.  She sells to her customers from her home by herself and does not have any major difficulties.  Agossi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal and corn.  She wants to re-invest in her business.  Over the next few years, Agossi would like to improve her level of business by adding other products.  She says that with the profits, she plans to look after her children and improve their level of education.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and corn.

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr:
Gaméli est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il n’a pas encore d’enfants. Gaméli travaille comme revendeur de matériels électroniques et de plomberie depuis 2010. Il vend seul et n’a aucune difficulté principale. 
Gaméli a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut investir dans le commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Gaméli voudrait  faire développer son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit améliorer le niveau de vie.
texts.en: Gaméli is a 27 year old man.  He is married to a hairstylist.  He does not have any children as of yet.  Gaméli has worked as an electronic and plumbing equipment retailer since 2010.  He sells by himself and has no major difficulties.  Gaméli has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise.  He wants to invest in his business.  Over the next few years, Gaméli wants to his business to develop.  He says that with the profits, he plans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase electronic and plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Koffi Mawulé

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Koffi est informaticien et a ouvert un cyber depuis 2004. Il s’est installé dans un quartier de la place.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus d’ordinateurs pour agrandir son cyber. Il veut investir dans l’activité avec le profit réalisé. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait avoir d’autres cybers pour permettre à la population de mieux surfer . Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Koffi is a 34-year old man, who is single and has no children. He is a computer technician and opened a cyber-café in 2004. He is situated in one of the town' districts. He has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy more computers and expand his cyber-café. He wants to invest the profits he makes in his business. In the coming years, Koffi would like to have other cyber-cafés in order to allow people to surf the net better. He says that he wants to improve his living standards with the profits.

loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Mulwanda Group

texts.en:
Phanice is the facilitator of the Mulwanda group. Phanice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phanice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Phanice joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phanice had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phanice was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Phanice will invest in a cow and then build a house. In 2012, the members of Mulwanda group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Le premier a 16ans et le dernier 12ans.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de friperie depuis 2010. Elle a boutique dans laquelle elle répond à la demande de la clientèle. Elle n’a aucune difficulté dans l’exercice de son activité.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait élargir l’activité en ouvrant d’autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit s’occuper de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 34-year old woman, who is a widow. She has two children who are both at school; the eldest is 16 years old and the youngest 12 years old. Afi has been working as a second-hand clothes retailer since 2010. She has a shop where she meets customer demand. She has no problems in running her business.

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy goods. She wants to reinvest in the business. In the coming years, Afi would like to expand her business by opening other shops. She says that with the profits she makes she is planning to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme  âgé(e) de 39 ans. Afi est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. 
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et de céréales depuis 2001. Afi vend seule à ses clients au marché. Sa difficulté principale est le retard dans la livraison. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des céréales. Afi veut réinvestir dans l’activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait augmenter son fonds de commerce. Afi dit qu’avec les profits, Afi prévoit améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Afi is a 39 year old woman.  She is single and has no children.  Afi has worked as a charcoal and grains retailer since 2001.  She sells her products by herself to her customers at the market.  Her main difficulty is with late deliveries.  Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of charcoal and grains.  Afi wants to re-invest in her business with the profits she makes.  Over the next few years, Afi would like to increase her business.
 Afi says that with her profits, she plans to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Acheter des charbons de bois et des céréales

loans.name: Nderema B Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Nderema B group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, John had an excellent maize yield harvesting 22 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children and pay off loans and debts.

In 2012, the members of Nderema B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

John is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jitegemee B Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the Jitegemee B group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a good maize yield harvesting 6 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Martin was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Martin

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Martin, âgé de 41 ans  célibataire et père de 4 enfants  a récemment investi dans la vente de denrées alimentaires et  d’habits.
Il veut acquérir un prêt pour acheter des habits adaptés au froid et préparer  les fêtes de Noel et de fin d’années.
Avec  les revenus de son commerce il arrive à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et veut élargir son activité car il a l’intention de vendre aussi de la boisson.
texts.en:
Martin is 41 years old, single and the father of 4 children. He has recently started a business selling food and clothing. He is requesting a loan so that he can stock up on cold weather clothing and products to sell during the Christmas and New Year celebrations.

Martin uses his earnings to pay for his children´s education and also plans to reinvest some into his business, as he would like to expand his activities and start selling drinks.

loans.use: to buy food and clothes to resell during the end of year festivities.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она трудиться каждый день, чтобы немножко улучшить свои условия жизни и поэтому она выбрала аграрный бизнес. Земля приносит ей хороший доход, и доходы обеспечивают семью сельхозпродуктами. Более 13 лет она занимается выращиванием пшеницы и картошки. Её семья дружная и члены семьи помогают ей по бизнесу. Она хочет получить хорошую прибыль и планирует отремонтировать свой дом и провести свадьбу сына. Зебо запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки семена картофеля.
texts.en: Zebo is a hard-working and diligent woman. She is married and is a loving mother of 3 children. She works hard every day to improve her living conditions and that is why she has chosen agriculture as her business. The land brings her a good income and that income provides her family with groceries. She has been growing wheat and potatoes for over 13 years.  Her family is united and family members help her with the business. She wants to generate good revenue and is planning to fix up her house and have a wedding for her son. Zebo is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy potato seeds.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Tadjigul

texts.ru:
Тажигул 56 лет, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей. Тажигул работает на почте города Баткен. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Тажигул начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Стартовав с суммы 17,000 сом (KGS), Тажигул благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  15,000 сом (KGS). Товар в магазин Тажигул привозит с разных рынков, в том числе и ездит на закуп в город Ош, находящийся в 240 км.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тажигул обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Тажигул планирует вложить в  дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Tadjigul is 56 years old, married, and has raised five children. Tadjigul works at the post office in the city of Batken. In 2006, seeking an additional source of income for her family, Tadjigul started her own business selling groceries. Thanks to her persistance and hard work, Tadjigul was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS) after beginning with 17,000 som (KGS) in startup capital. Tadjigul brings products to her store from various markets, which includes trips to shop in the city of Osh 240 kilometers away. In order further to grow her business, Tadjigul has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to expand her inventory. Tadjigul plans to invest the income from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Mukhuyu Y.g.a Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the facilitator of the Mukhuyu Y.G.A. group. Caleb and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caleb and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Caleb takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Caleb had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caleb was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Caleb will educate his children and ensure food security for his family.

In 2012, the members of Mukhuyu Y.G.A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Caleb is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Huruma C Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the facilitator of the Huruma C group. Joseph and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Joseph was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joseph will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Huruma C group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tushirikiane A Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of the Tushirikiane A group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Jane joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest 9 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Jane invest in a cow and then build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Tushirikiane A group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sadatou

texts.fr:
Sadatou est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 3 enfants.
Sadatou travaille comme commerçante depuis 1991. Elle vend des produits d'alimentations à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Sadatou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des garnitures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Sadatou voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Sadatou is a 42 year old woman.  She is married to a shopkeeper.  She has three children.  Sadatou  has worked as a shopkeeper since 1991.  She sells food products from her home.  She buys her products in Lomé.  She works alone.  At the moment, she has no business problems.  Sadatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy garnishes.  She wants to re-invest in her business.  Over the next few years, Sadatou would like to open a shop.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase general food products.

loans.name: Aissa Kane

texts.fr:
Mme Aissa Kane est une dame qui fait du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans .Elle est âgée de 45 ans et a six enfants.
Son activité consiste à acheter  des tissus teints à partir du Mali et de venir les revendre  au Sénégal.
Madame Aissa Kane n’a pas de charges ce qui lui permet de réinvestir son bénéfice  dans  son commerce
texts.en:
Aissa Kane is 45 years old and has 6 children. She has been active in commerce for over 20 years and has a business buying dyed fabrics in Mali and reselling them in Senegal.

Aissa Kane would use the loan to restock on fabrics for resale. She has no financial responsibilities and can afford to reinvest her earnings back into her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Messan est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 3 enfants.
Messan travaille comme charcutier depuis 2009. Il vend de la viande de porc pour tous clients à Lomé. Il achète les produits à Vogan et Ayépé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, il n’a pas de difficulté.
Messan a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des porcs. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Messan voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Messan is a 44 year old man.  He is married to a retailer.  He has three children.  Messan has worked as a pork butcher since 2009.  He sells pork meat for all of his clients in Lomé.  He buys his products in Vogan and Ayépé.  He works alone.  At the moment, he has no business problems.  Messan has asked for his first loan from WAGES in order to buy some pigs.  He wants to re-invest in his business.  Over the next few years, Messan would like to increase the size of his business.  He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Agneta is the facilitator of the Upendo group. Agneta and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agneta and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Agneta joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agneta had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agneta was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Agneta will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Agneta with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wechinia B Group

texts.en:
Mary is the facilitator of the Wechinia B group. Mary and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

Mary joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on that land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jitegemee C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Jitegemee C Group in Western Kenya! Concepta is the facilitator of the Jitegemee C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Concepta takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Concepta had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Concepta was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Concepta and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Concepta will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee C group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Eya est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est marié å un agent de sécurité. Elle a 2 enfants.
Eya travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2007. Elle vend de la nourriture pour tous clients dans un bar restaurant. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de  difficulté.
Eya a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des condiments pour la restauration. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Eya voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eya is 38 years old. She is married to a security officer and has 2 children.

Eya has been a restaurant owner since 2007 and sells food to all the customers in a bar/restaurant. She buys her products in Lomé. She works by herself, and for the time being it's not a problem.

Eya has asked for her 1st loan from WAGES to buy spices for her restaurant. She would like to reinvest in her work. 

Over the next few years, Eya would like to increase the size of her business. She says she will use her profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and yams.

loans.name: Kujitafutia Group

texts.en:
Boaz is the facilitator of the Kujitafutia group. Boaz and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Boaz takes care of two children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Boaz had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Boaz was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Boaz and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Boaz will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Kujitafutia group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Boaz is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya. He is 23 years old and single. He has been actively farming for more than three years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces bananas, maize, beans, and milk. In addition to farming, he works as a plumber.

Paul has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and irrigation pipes for his farming business. This is his second loan with Juhudi; his previous loan was for 30,000 KES. He adds that his farming activities will be more successful with sufficient water supply.

Paul laments the high costs of inputs like fertilizers and the low prices for farming products.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Talé Hortance

texts.fr:
Talé est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 1 enfant. 
Talé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1997. Elle vend des friperies pour tous clients de façon  ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Hedzranawoe. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Talé a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Talé voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Talé is 38 years old. She is a widow and has one child.

Talé has been a vendor since 1997. She sells second-hand clothing to all her customers on foot.

She buys her products in Hedzranawoe. She works by herself. For the time being, she is not having any problems. 

Talé has asked for her first loan from WAGES to buy second-hand clothes. She would like to reinvest in her business. 

Over the next few years, she'd like to grow her business. She says she will take care of her family with her profits.

loans.use: to buy dozens of dresses, pants, and knit items.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Intisar is a 36-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She believes that by cooperating with her husband they will be able to cover their family's needs and expenses. That’s why she decided to start her own home business as a tailor in 2007. Her husband has been serving in the Lebanese army for the past twenty years. Today she wants to borrow 1,100 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of textiles. In the future, she plans to open her own evening dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase textiles

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 30 year old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of four years and 9 months. One of them goes to school. 

Emmanuel runs a cosmetics business, and he has been in the business for two years. He has no employees. Emmanuel heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of SDG 2000 to purchase items like tea tree oil, coconut oil, caro light oil and many others.  Other than this business, Emmanuel has no source of income. 

In five years' time, Emmanuel would like to build his own house instead of renting . 

His major challenges include the competitors and a low income rate.

Emmanuel says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance Sudan for its support, and that God should bless the company.

loans.use: to purchase items like tea tree oil, coconut oil, carolight oil and many others.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Mme Seynabou  est une femme de 53 ans très brave et très active. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle a démarré par la vente de poisson puis s’est lancé après une longue rupture à la vente de légumes.
Avec le crédit, elle veut  acheter en grande quantité du poisson séché pour le revendre dans le marché local. 
Elle réinvesti dans son petit commerce les bénéfices de son activité puisse qu’elle n’a pas de charges  familiales.
texts.en:
Seynabou is an active and reliable 53-year-old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been active in commerce for over 25 years. She began by selling fish and then, much later, started selling vegetables.

Seynabou will use this loan to buy a large amount of dried fish for resale at the local market. Because she is not responsible for any household expenses, she is able to reinvest her profits into her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has worked in farming for the last five years, and earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. He is 29 years old, and married to Mary. They do not have children yet. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30, 000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to purchase animal feed.

He will save his profits and also provide for his family's basic needs. In the future he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26 year old business-lady.  She sells shoes and trousers to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years.  She started her business after getting enough capital from her car hire business. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business because she has been economically empowered and has been trained on business management skills.
Alice hopes to move to a bigger business premises in five years.  She needs a loan of 70, 000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes and trousers.

loans.use: To buy shoes and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Vuyanzi Farmers Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is the facilitator of the Vuyanzi Farmers group. Rosemary and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. Rosemary takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With the income from maize sales, Rosemary will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Vuyanzi Farmers group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Obulafu Group

texts.en:
Ronald is the facilitator of the Obulafu group. Ronald and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Ronald takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ronald had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ronald was only able to harvest one bag of maize on half an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ronald and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Ronald will educate his children and pay back his loans and bills. 

In 2012, the members of Obulafu group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Ronald is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mouroussiatou

texts.fr:
Mouroussiatou est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un tapissier. Elle a 2 enfants. 
Mouroussiatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle travaille seule. Au moment,elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Mouroussiatou a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mouroussiatou voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mouroussiatou is a 35-year-old woman. She is married to a tapestry craftsman. She has two children.

Mouroussiatou has been working as a retailer since 2003. She sells grain to clients at home. She purchases her stock in Anié. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties. Mouroussiatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase grain. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Mouroussiatou would like to increase the size of her business. She says that she plans to use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase grain for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells mobile phones, chargers and other accessories. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mobile phones for resale, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and open another branch in a neighboring town. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house and work from home. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Gregory has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells groundnuts, millet and sorghum. 

To help expand his business, Gregory has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sorghum and groundnuts for resale. It will help Gregory to generate greater profits and add to his limited stock of groundnuts. Gregory hopes that in the future he will be able to construct a permanent house for his family. 

Gregory is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gregory who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 29 years old, married and with two children.  He runs a butcher shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for seven years. He runs the business with one employee.  He has grown his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.
Charles hopes to become financially stable in five years.  He needs a loan of 40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a weighing machine.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Robert has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells groundnuts, millet and sorghum. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet to sell, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and eventually purchase more groundnuts. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to build a permanent house for his family. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more millet to sell.

loans.name: Abdellahatif

texts.en:
Abdellahatif is a 35-year-old business man, who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 11 and 2 months. Two of them go to school. 

Abdellahatif has run a food store for three years. He has no employees. Abdellatif heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion done by the loan officers in the market. He is taking a loan of SDG 2,000 to purchase items like wheat flour, washing soap, detergent, sugar and many others. Abdellahatif has no other source of income aside from this business. 

In 5 years time, Abdellahatif hopes he will have a better life and maybe have a good house.  

His major challenges include the low income and high cost of living in Juba.

Abdellahatif says that he appreciates that Finance Sudan also considers men for loans because some of the MFIs only consider women.

loans.use: to purchase items like wheat flour, washing soap, sugar and many others.

loans.name: Perez

texts.en:
Perez is 29 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past ten years, Perez has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Perez has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food products for resale and will help Perez to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Perez hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another branch. 

Perez is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Perez who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food products for resale.

loans.name: Upendo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Upendo Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Night is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Night takes care of four children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Night had a very good maize yield harvesting six bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Night was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Night and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. With the income from maize sales, Night will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Upendo Farmers group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luvambo Group

texts.en:

Benard takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had a very good maize yield harvesting six and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benard was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Benard will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Luvambo group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Benard is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mme Awa est  vendeuse de balaie, d’huile de palme et d’autres produits provenant  du sud du pays : de la Casamance. Awa est mariée et fait du commerce depuis 1998 
Avec le crédit elle veut acheter 20 litres d’huile de palme et des balaies.
Dans l’avenir elle compte vendre en même temps des chaussures, des bracelets…
texts.en:
Awa is married and has been active in commerce since 1998. She sells brooms, palm oil and other products from the Casamance region in the south of the country.

Awa will use the loan to buy 20 litres of palm oil and some brooms. Eventually, she would like to expand her range of goods and start selling products like shoes and bracelets.

loans.use: to restock on palm oil and brooms.

loans.name: Engisa Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Engisa group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, John had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest four bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, John will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Engisa group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalene is 41 years old, married and with four children between age 10-23.  She practices dairy farming to earn a living.  She has been a farmer for twelve years.  Apart from dairy farming, she rears pigs.  She says that she has witnessed a lot of growth since she joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because she has been trained on business management skills.
Magdalene hopes to farm in large-scale in five years.  She has requested for 39, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

Tom takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Tom had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Tom was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With the income from maize sales, Tom will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Vuhika group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

The photograph shows Tom with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his bar, in which he sells wine, beer and soda. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer and soda, and will help Yusuf to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Yusuf hopes that in the future he will be able to have one of the biggest bars in town. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a farmer based in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is married and has four children, all adults save for the last child, who is still in school. 

She has been in farming for 17 years and produces wheat, milk, potatoes, and maize among other cereals (grains). Her produce goes to the local market. She also operates a cereals retail business in the local market. Her cereals are sourced from her farm as well as other farmers.

Anna has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her milk production and income, which she will also use to improve her cereals retail business and pay for the education of her last born child.

Anna laments the high costs of farm inputs and poor prices for the products.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Anta est une jeune marchande de fruits  âgée de 24 ans. Elle a quitté tôt les bancs pour se lancer dans le petit commerce il y a de cela 10 ans.
Elle se met à un arrêt de car pour vendre des oranges, des mandarines et d’autres fruits de la période.
Malgré son jeune âge Anta participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle est ambitieuse car elle veut devenir une grande commerçante dans ce domaine.
texts.en: Anta is a young fruit vendor, 24 years of age. She dropped out of school early in order to go into small business. This was 10 years ago. She switched gears in order to sell oranges, tangerines and other seasonal fruits. In spite of her young age, Anta contributes to the family budget. She is ambitious and would like to become a big vendor in this field.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her second-hand clothes store, which sells various kinds of clothes and bedcovers. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bundles of clothes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up clothes shops in other areas. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothes.

The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from her maize sales, Concepter will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Suvila group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert runs a butcher shop as his primary business and also sells clothes, a business managed by the wife.  He has been doing these for the last five years, and earns a monthly profit of KES. 25,000. His other source of income is through farming. He is 32 years-old and married to Mary.  They have two school going children. 

He has applied for his third loan of  KES. 50, 000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD, and he plans to use part of the loan to buy more stock of meat to sell,  and also buy more clothes for sale during high season.

The anticipated profits he will save and provide for the family basic needs. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat to sell and  also buy more clothes for sale during high season .

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 33 years old and owns a restaurant in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is a married father of one child. His restaurant has been in business for the past three years, and it is doing great. 

This is Moses' second loan from KADET LTD to expand his business. He plans to purchase chairs, tables and utensils for his restaurant. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and utensils for his restaurant

loans.name: Amani B Group

texts.en:
Erastus is the facilitator of the Amani B group. Erastus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Erastus takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Erastus had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Erastus was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Erastus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Erastus will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amani B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Azinafa

texts.en:
Azinafa is 51 years old and has been farming for 15 years. She has one farmhand who helps her. Her farm produces milk, beans, maize, and vegetables for the local market.

Azinafa has requested a loan of 87,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use 52,000 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow, and she will use 35,000 KES to construct a dairy unit for her dairy animals. She hopes to double her milk production, which will double her income and help her to afford a better living standard for her family.

She laments the cost of feed during dry seasons.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mjini A Group

texts.en:
Edward is the facilitator of the Mjini A group. Edward and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edward takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Edward had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edward was only able to harvest one bag of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edward and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edward will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mjini A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: Maria Mariana,es una señora conocida como una persona muy luchadora en el campo del negocio,ella tiene 41 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos,y a la vez vende productos comestibles,ella nos cuenta que desde hace tiempos se dedico a este negocio ya que en la comunidad donde ella vive no hay mucha competencia,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos,ya que en esta epoca de fin de año es cuando se vende mas.
texts.en: Maria Mariana is known as a real go-getter when it comes to business. She is 41 years old and sells cosmetics, as well as some groceries. She has told us that she has been involved in this business for a long time as there is not much competition in the community where she lives. She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics, as this is the time of the year when they sell the most.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Russel Leonor

texts.es: La Señora Russel Leonor trabaja en una empresa de limpieza de la ciudad de La Paz, también se dedica a la venta de juguetes y electrodomésticos; su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería. El crédito que solicita es para compra de mercadería (juguetes y electrodmésticos) para ponerla a la venta aprovechando las fiestas navideñas. Russel tiene dos hijos Vive en casa en anticretico ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita que su crédito sea canalizado a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Russel Leonor works for a cleaning company in the city of La Paz. She also sells toys and household appliances. Her husband sells hardware. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise (toys and household appliances) to sell so that she can take advantage of the Christmas festivities. Russel has two children and lives in a rented house in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that her loan requested has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy toys and household appliances to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Ben is the facilitator of the Njete group. Ben and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ben takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Ben had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ben was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Ben will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto es jubilado y recibe una renta mensual. El crédito que requiere es para la construcción de muro frontal de su domicilio e instalación de gas domiciliario. Ernesto es viudo y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de San Pedro  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto is retired and receives a monthly pension. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a wall at the front of his house and to install a gas line. Ernesto is a widower and has one child. He lives in his own home in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to build a wall and to install a gas line in his home.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio es jubilado y recibe una renta mensual. El crédito que requiere es para la construcción de muros en la planta alta de su domicilio. Sergio es casado y tiene cinco  hijos de los cuales cuatro de ellos se encuentran casados .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Obispo Bosque  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos anteriormente otorgados ya que le ayudo a construir su vivienda. Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio is retired and receives a monthly pension. The loan he is requesting will be used for the construction of walls on the upper floor of his home. Sergio is married and has five children, four of whom are married. He lives in his own home in the District of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz.

Sergio is very pleased with the previous loans that were granted to him because they have helped in the construction of his house. This is the fourth time that his loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to build walls on the upper floor of his house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 26-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 9 and 7, all in school, lives and farms in Kitale, Western Kenya. She relies on farming fully for her family upkeep, producing milk, maize and vegetables for the local market. She currently employs one farmhand.

Sarah has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will boost her farming income and enable her to expand her other businesses as well as educate her children. While lamenting the fluctuations in farm produce prices, Sarah is glad to have access to Juhudi Kilimo loan services

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paper, ink, toner, and other supplies.

loans.name: Fanya Bidii Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Fanya Bidii Group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had a very good maize yield harvesting 9½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Moses will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Fanya Bidii Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The picture shows Moses and his group with the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ana Aida

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tamales, su negocio lo instala en el mercado municipal, ella vive con sus tres hijos menores. Ana administra el negocio desde hace varios años, en un horario de 8:00am hasta que los vende todos, aprendió a elaborarlos porque su madre le dedico tiempo para enseñarle.
Actualmente Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz (en elote), para hacer tamales de maíz tierno, el préstamo le ayudara para comprar varios canastos de maíz, para poder preparar tamales y tener disponibilidad de materia prima.
La aspiración de ella es continuar trabajando, poco a poco ganar más clientes, mejorando así las condiciones económicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Ana sells tamales from her business at the municipal market. She lives with her three young children. Ana has managed her business for several years. Her schedule starts at 8am and continues until she sells everything. She learned how to make tamales from her mother who took the time to teach her.

Ana is currently requesting a loan to buy fresh corn for making tamales. This loan will help her to buy several baskets of corn so that she can prepare the tamales and have enough supplies on hand. She aspires to continue working, gradually gaining more customers, and improving her family’s financial condition.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El señor Cirilo trabaja de electricista en la sub-alcaldía de uno de los barrios de la ciudad de La Paz y además tiene una tienda de barrio la cual esta ubicada en su  misma casa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería, como ser arroz, azucar, fideos, galletas, etc., para poner variedad a su tienda y ofrecerla a su  clientela .Cirilo tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales tres ya están casados .Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Pasankeri Sur de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y también la segunda vez con Kiva.
texts.en:
Cirilo works as an electrician in the deputy mayor’s office in one of the neighborhoods in the city of La Paz.  He also has a neighborhood store in his house.

The loan that he needs is to buy merchandise like rice, noodles, and cookies, etc. so that he can put out a variety to offer to his customers.

Cirilo has four children, and three of them are married.  He lives in his own house in the Pasankeri Sur zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO and also the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cookies for his neighborhood store.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yaneth, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y de tortillas, vive con su esposo y sus hijas de 12 y 10 años de edad, tiene 8 meses en el negocio, hasta el momento todo le ha salido bien, espera adquirir más experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, estos materiales le servirán tanto para hacer las tortillas como también para hacer las pupusas, mejorando así su disponibilidad de productos para la preparación de la venta.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, poco a poco y con la ayuda de préstamos.
texts.en:
Yaneth sells pupusas and tortillas for a living.  She lives with her husband and her 10- and 12-year-old daughters.  She has had her business for eight months and so far everything has gone well for her.  She hopes to acquire more experience.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood, oil, and condiments.  These materials will help her make both her tortillas and her pupusas, thereby improving the availability of products she has to prepare and sell.

Her aspiration is to grow her business little by little with the help of loans.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Massavi

texts.fr:
Massavi est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée  å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants.
Massavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des matériaux de construction pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés.
Massavi a requis son 2ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de construction. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Massavi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Massavi is a 45-year-old woman. She is married to a shopkeeper and has two children.

Massavi has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells construction supplies to all of her customers out of her shop.  She stocks up in Lomé. She works by herself, and at the moment is not encountering any difficulties.

Massavi is taking out her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase construction supplies inventory. She wants to reinvest in her business.  In the coming years, Massavi would like to increase her productivity, and says that she plans to use the profits to take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies inventory.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Señora Martha genera sus ingresos con el trabajo de transportista que su esposo desempeña en su movilidad. El crédito que solicita es para gastos funerarios de su hijo mayor el cual se encuentra en el hospital con vida artificial hace tiempo y es lamentable su estado de salud, de tal manera que se tomó la decisión de que descanse en la Paz del Señor.  Martha vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Alto Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz. Martha tiene cuatro hijos. Este es un caso muy particular y especial, en el que prima la voluntad de ayuda a Martha.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha generates income in the transportation business with her husband driving their vehicle. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay the funeral expenses for her eldest son. He had been in the hospital for some time on life support and was in a declining state of health. They made the decision to allow him to rest in peace with God. Martha lives in her own home in the District of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. She has four children.

This is a very unique and special case, so best wishes are being extended in order to assist Martha.

loans.use: to pay for her son's funeral expenses.

loans.name: Veronica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 8 y 17 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de merienda y frutas, desde hace un año desempeña esta actividad, atiende sola el negocio todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, aceite, condimentos y más frutas frescas, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar el inventario y la variedad en el negocio.
La aspiración de Verónica es que su negocio prospere y junto a él sus ganancias, para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and three children who are 15, 8, and 17 years old.  She sells snacks and fruit for a living.  She has been doing this for a year now and she runs her business all alone every day of the week.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy corn, oil, condiments, and more fresh fruits.  These purchases will help her improve her inventory and the variety she offers in her business.

Verónica's aspiration is for her business to prosper, and her earnings along with it, so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments, and more fresh fruits

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis es jubilado y recibe renta al igual que su esposa. El crédito lo requiere para un tratamiento médico general  para su esposa, pues necesita hacerse el chequeo anual y no tienen seguro médico. José tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa en anticrético la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Achumani  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito otorgado ya que le ayudara a su esposa a estar mejor de salud. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Impro y también con kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. José Luis is retired. He and his wife receive a pension. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for general medical treatment for his wife who needs her annual checkup. They do not have medical insurance. José Luis has two children and lives in a rented house in the District of Achumani in the city of La Paz.

He is very pleased with the loan that has been granted because it will help his wife stay healthy. This is the first time José Luis has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical checkup.

loans.name: Bidii B  Shg Group

texts.en:
George is the facilitator of the Bidii B SHG group. George and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had a good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, George will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bidii B SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase jewelry and bazin [ornamental fabric].

loans.name: Amigos Triunfadores Group

texts.es: Norma es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Amigos Triunfadores” grupo conformado por 11 socios que llevan trabajando 08 meses con el Programa – Prosperidad. Norma tiene 54 años de edad es  madre soltera, tiene 05 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando al menor de ellos. Desde hace 20 años Norma trabaja en una avícola en el área de reparto de pollos, aparte tiene un negocio de venta de productos de belleza, también realiza tejidos como chompas, guantes, pantalones, entre otros la cual trabaja sobre pedidos obteniendo así un ingreso extra para su hogar, gracias a estas actividades Norma ha  podido brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos ya que han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Con el fin de seguir superándose solicito el préstamo para invertir en sus productos de belleza comprando talcos, perfumes, cremas y así tener un stock guardado. El sueño de Norma es  de instalar un bazar y de esa manera asegurar su vejez. Norma junto a la Alcancía Comunal “Amigos Triunfadores” agradecen el crédito  brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien.
texts.en: Norma is a member of the Amigos Triunfadores Communal Bank, which is made up of 11 members who have been working with Programa Prosperidad for eight months.  Norma is a 54-year-old single mother with five children who currently still supports her youngest child.  For 20 years, Norma has worked at a poultry farm distributing chickens.  Aside from that, she has a business selling beauty products and she also sews items like sweaters, gloves, and pants, among other things, when she receives orders.  This offers her extra income for her household.  Thanks to these business activities, Norma has been able to offer her children a better life, as they have been her motivation to get ahead.  With the goal of continuing to better herself, she is asking for this loan to invest in her beauty products by buying powders, perfumes, and creams in order to have a reserve of stock.  Norma's dream is to set up a store that would provide for her in her old age.  Norma and the Amigos Triunfadores Communal Bank are thankful for the loan that has been offered them and promise to continue working hard.

loans.use: to buy powders, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La señora Adelina  tiene veinte nueva años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace siete meses.
Es soltera  y no tiene hijos lo que más le gusta de su negocio es acomodar la ropa y darle un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Ellas nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio le deja buenas ganacias  y en las tardes se dedica a la venta de pan ya que en su localidad se vende muy bien el pan ella se locompara a su compañera de grupo la señora Sonia.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra  de más ropa para la venta  ya que su negocio le deja buenas  ganancias.
Le da las gracias a  fundación por el apoyo que  le ha  dado para  seguir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adelina is 29. She has sold clothing for seven months.
She is single and has no children. What she most enjoys about her business is arranging the clothing and providing a good customer service.
She tells us that her business is going very well for her and she makes a good income from it. In the afternoons, she sells bread. In her area, bread sells very well. She buys the bread from her fellow group member, Mrs. Sonia.
Adelina requested this loan for the purchase of more clothing to sell, since her business makes her a good income.
She thanks the Fundacion for the support that they have given her so that she can get ahead and triumph in life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Celina Del Sagrario

texts.es:
Celina, vive con sus hijos, quienes estudian, ella tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos; Celina se dedica a la venta de juguetes, tiene más de 10 años de estar en dicho negocio, sus lugares de venta son las escuelas, fuera de las iglesias y en los parques.
Actualmente Celina solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes, dicha compra le ayudara para obtener nuevos muñecos, y juguetes de entretenimiento para los niños.
Las aspiración de ella es abastecer el negocio con este préstamo, para prepararse para la etapa de navidad, de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Celina, 47, lives with her three children, who are in school. She has sold toys for over ten years. She sells in schools, outside of churches, and in parks.
She currently needs a loan for the purchase of toys; she will buy new dolls and toys for entertaining children.
She hopes to stock her business with this loan, in order to get ready for the Christmas season. This will increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Cupertina

texts.es:
Doña Cupertina  es  una señora Indígena humilde llena de sueños para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
Se dedica a la venta de  pozole y a la venta de carne y pan, lo que más le gusta es hacer pozole y vender pan ya que  es lo que más se vende.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Adrián  quien la apoya  y le ayuda en sus negocios  para que  no se canse tanto.
Tambien le ayuda a la señora Sonia a la elaboracion de pan para tener un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia.
Pidio el prestamo para comprar maiz,aceite y cebolla para la elaboracion de pozole.
Tiene  una hija Aidé quien la ayuda en la venta de pozole.
Doña Cupertina está embarazada tiene  siete meses de embarazada está muy contenta ya que con el apoyo de fundación tiene herramientas para darle un mejor futuro.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudar  y ayudar a su familia  para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Cupertina is a humble Indian woman full of dreams to get ahead and achieve her dreams.

She sells pozole, meat, and bread for a living.  She most enjoys making pozole and selling bread because those are what sell the most. 

She is happily married to Adrián, who supports her and helps her with her business so that she doesn't get too tired.

She asked for this loan to buy corn, oil, and onions to make pozole.

She has a daughter, Aidé, who helps her sell her pozole.

Cupertina is seven months pregnant and she is very happy because, with the support of the Foundation, she has the tools to giver her child a better future.

She thanks the Foundation for helping her and her family have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pozole

loans.name: Dénis

texts.fr:
Denis est  un homme âgé de 47 ans. Il est mariée å une revendeuse de friperie. Il a 4 enfants.
Denis travaille comme revendeur depuis 2005. Il vend des chaussures pour femmes au marché. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Denis a requis son 4ème  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures pour femme. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Denis voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Denis is a 47 year old man. He is married to a retailer of used clothing. He has four children. Denis has worked as a retailer since 2005. He sells women's shoes at the market. He purchases the products in Lomé. He works alone. At the moment, he has no difficulties. Denis has requested his fourth WAGES loan to purchase shoes. He wants to reinvest in the business. In the next years, Denis would like to increase the size of his business. He says that with the profits, he plans to take care of his family.

loans.use: Buy women's shoes

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es:
