The member travels each month to get merchandise and at this time because of the Christmas holidays the member wants to travel to fetch stuffed toys in order to sell them for Christmas Eve. 

The member has her business in a known shopping center. The member is asking for a loan to buy the stuffed toys in order to sell them on Christmas Eve. The member also will use the money from the loan for the trips she has to make.

The member is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy stuffed toys yo sell for Christmas Eve.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purlins, bricks, iron, tie wire, sand, gravel, 3/8 iron, and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lottery tickets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home by buying construction materials

loans.name: Wuilman Antonio

texts.es:
Don Wuilman sigue laborando como cadete de taxi, de su propio vehiculo, el cual lleva varios años, dando este servicios, sus tres hijos estudian, su esposa, tiene una pqueña pulperia en donde se ayudan ambos con los gastos del hogar.
Don Wuilman devio su credito anterior, que era para construir parte del muro delantero, devido a que su taxi le dio falla mecanica, el cual dio pioridad, siendo su instrumento de trabajo.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, hara la instalacion de servicios higienicos, comprando inodoro, lavamanos, tuvos para aguas negras, lo que dara a su familia mejores condiciones de higiene.
texts.en:
Wuilman continues to work as a taxi driver with his own vehicle.  He has had this business providing taxi services for a number of years.  His 3 children are in school and his wife has a small grocery store.  Together, he and his wife pay for the household expenses.

Wuilman took a previous loan to build a wall around the front of his house, but instead he used it to make repairs to his taxi, which was having mechanical problems.  He had to give priority to the taxi, as he cannot work without it.

Today with this new loan he will upgrade his bathroom by purchasing a toilet, a sink and sewage pipes.  This will provide his family with better hygienic conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a toilet, providing better hygiene for his family

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 49 años convive junto a Mauro de 52 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos Iván y Kendy, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Carmen, se levanta muy temprano y en compañía de su pareja se dirigen a sus chacras para cuidar de sus plantas de cacao y achiote, ya que es el sustento de vida que poseen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver a diario el avance de sus plantas y esperar la cosecha; lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo mas difícil es no poder combatir con las plagas de insectos que perjudiquen  su producción. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar plantas de frutas para sembrar en sus tierras para después cosecharlas y venderlas ya que vio que es muy rentable. Este será su préstamo número 03 con MFP, y esta apta a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando plantas de frutas como: naranja, piña, pacay, entre otros. Para poder tener mas productos en sus tierras y venderlas a buen precio.
texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Carmen lives with her partner, 52-year-old Mauro, in their own home with their two children, Iván and Kendy, who are their motivation to work hard.  Carmen gets up very early and, together with her partner, goes to their farms to take care of their cacao and annatto plants, since these are their only means of support.  What she likes most about her work is seeing her plants grow on a daily basis and waiting for the harvest.  She has been doing this for 10 years and she thinks the most difficult part of it is not being able to fight the plagues of insects that damage her crops.  With this loan, she will be able to buy fruit plants to plant on her land and later harvest and sell, as she has seen that this is very profitable.  This will be her third loan with MFP and she is good about making her payments on time since she wants to take out more loans afterward.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles to buy fruit plants, such as orange, pineapple, and pacay, among others.  This will allow her to produce more on her land and sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fruit plants such as orange, pineapple, and pacay

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, beef, chicken, pork, potatoes and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve living conditions

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 30 años convive junto a Rubén de 33 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar un futuro mejor. La tienda de Elva es la primera en abrirse en la ciudad de Quimbiri, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 01 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela ampliar su negocio y brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este será su préstamo número 09 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con su trabajo. Además le agrada ser parte de banco comunal ya que son personas responsables y solidarias. Con los 3,000 soles, invertirá comprando productos para incrementar en su tienda como: arroz, galletas, gaseosas, conservas, etc.
texts.en:
Elva is 30 years old and lives together with Rubén who is 33 years old. They live in their own house together with their 3 dear children and want to give them a better future. Elva’s store is the first to open in the city of Quimbiri; at 6:00AM in the morning her doors are ready to receive the shoppers who know the variety of merchandise that she has in her store and don’t hesitate to buy it, having the security of knowing they are going to find the things they need.

What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for one year and she thinks that the most difficult part is being inside the store all day without being able to leave.

She yearns to expand her business over time, and give her clients a better service. This will be her 9th loan with MFP, and she is asking for a small loan in order to be able to do her work. Further, she likes being a part of the communal bank because everyone is trustworthy and cooperative. With the 3000 soles, she will buy supplies for the store such as rice, cookies, soft drinks, canned foods and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, cookies, soft drinks, canned foods and other items

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos para el negocio como quesillo, chicharrón, maíz y frijoles, para realizar la venta de pupusas, ella se animo por el nuevo tramite, porque le pareció la atención y además por la oportunidad para crecer con el negocio.
Para Milagro y su negocio, estos préstamos han representado un avance, ya que su capacidad ha aumentado, ella cuenta con salud y con un negocio que cada día crece.
texts.en:
Milagro needs a new loan to purchase supplies for her business such as cheese, shredded pork, corn and beans so she can sell pupusas. She decided to ask for a loan because of the new (field partner’s) procedure, because she liked the customer service she received and also because of the growth opportunity for her business. 
To Milagro and her business, these loans have brought about progress because her capacity has increased. She is healthy and her business grows everyday.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, shredded pork, corn and beans

loans.name: Hilda Ivonne

texts.es:
La señora Ivonne es casada y vive con su esposo,ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en la parte delantera de su casa , el cual su marido  le construyo con materiales que compraron con un préstamo anterior.
 Desde hace algunos años su esposo se enfermó , por lo que ahora la mayor parte de la responsabilidad económica recae en la señora Ivonne.
Siempre ha trabajado como costurera , para lo cual estudio en el INA ( Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje).Es por esta razón que ahora desea aumentar sus ingresos produciendo maquila , es decir haciendo ropa en serie para venderla a un distribuidor.
 Necesita tener mejores máquinas, y  necesita comprar una máquina cover, que utilizará para dar un mejor acabado a las prendas que realizara: busos( ropa deportiva) y pijamas, para lo cual tambien necesitará comprar los hilos , las telas , zippers ,botones y demás materiales para la confección de esas prendas.
texts.en:
Ivonne is married and lives with her husband. She has a small sewing shop in the front of their home, which was built by her husband using materials they bought with a previous loan.
Ivonne’s husband fell ill some years ago and now Ivonne has become the household’s main provider. She has always worked as a seamstress, for which she was trained at INA (National Training Institute). She now wants to increase her income by working under a maquila scheme, i.e., starting a mass production of clothing and selling it to a distributor.
She needs to have better quality machines, as well as to purchase a cover sewing machine, which she will use to give a better finish to her garments, such as sweatshirts and pajamas. She will also need to purchase threads, fabrics, zippers, buttons and other supplies needed for sewing the clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a cover sewing machine and garment production supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials such as blocks, iron, concrete, door, sand and labor

loans.name: Shandy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Shandy;  La socia tiene 28 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 1 hijo de 8 años, la socia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de vinos, de forma independiente, la socia desea invertir en la compra de mercadería, la socia aprovechara las fiestas de navidad para comprar vinos en cajas al por mayor para distribuirlos en las diferentes tiendas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vinos al por mayor para las fiestas navideñas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to RICCHARY CUSCO Communal Bank, located in Huanchac district, Cusco Province, Cusco Department.
Her name is Shandy, 28. She is the single mother of a 8 year old child. She has an independent wine selling business. Shandy wants to invest buying stock. She wants to make a profit during the holiday season by buying wholesale wine boxes and retailing them to various stores. She requests this loan in order to buy wholesale wine for the holiday season.
Shandy is thankful for the loan and promises to repay on time, according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wine for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania, de 32 años convive junto a Edwin de 33 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 03 adorados hijos  quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. La tienda de Epifania es el más concurrido por sus vecinos de barrio en la ciudad de Quimbiri, todos los días sus clientes van desde muy temprano a la tienda de Epifania para comprar los productos que necesitan. Ella es una excelente vendedora ya que lo hace con mucha amabilidad, para que sus clientes puedan regresar ya que encuentran todo lo necesario que les haga falta. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es dar buen trato a sus clientes, lleva 01 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es no tener algunos productos ya que se terminan rápidamente. En adelante, espera incrementar productos para su negocio como: bebidas, variedades de golosinas, arroz, azúcar, conservas, entre otros. Este será su préstamo numero 07 con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá comprando productos para su negocio como: bebidas, variedades de golosinas, arroz, azúcar, conservas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Epifania who is 32 years old lives with Edwin who is 33 years old. They live in their own house together with their 3 beloved children who are the reason for their efforts. 

Epifania’s store is the most popular neighborhood store in the city of Qiimbiri. Every day her customers go there early to buy the things they need. She is an outstanding sales person and attends to her work with much friendliness in order for her customers to return where they will find all they need that they don’t have. 

The thing that she likes most about her work is dealing with her customers. She has been in this business one year and what she considers the most difficult is not having some products that have sold out rapidly.

In the future she hopes to expand the inventory for her store, such as soft drinks, varieties of cookies, rice, sugar, canned goods, and other items.

This will be her 7th loan with MFP, and she is hoping for approval in order to continue with her plans.

With the 1000 soles she will buy products for her business such as drinks, varieties of cookies, rice, sugar, canned goods and other items.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, varieties of cookies, rice, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Maedy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maedy;  La socia tiene 19 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia viaja al vecino país de Bolivia para traer ropa, bolsos, carteras, sacos, botas entre otras prendas de vestir, la socia suele viajar cada 15 o 30 días para este país para traer mercadería, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa, carteras, bolsos, botas, entre otras prendas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Ricchary Cusco. The communal bank can be found in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

The member is Maedy. She is 19 years old and is single. 

The member travels to the neighboring country of Bolivia in order to buy clothing, handbags, wallets, jackets, boots and other clothing items. The member usually travels every 15 or 30 days in order to bring back merchandise. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy clothes, wallets, handbags, boots and other clothing items. The member is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothing, wallets, handbags, boots and other items of clothing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita vive en un hermoso lugar de Costa Rica llamado las Nubes de Coronado, su casa es tipica de la zona rural costarricense,ahí vive con uno de sus hermanos. Hace algunos años dejo el trabajo que tenia y decidió montar un negocio en uno de los aposentos de su casa,ahi tiene todo tipo de regalos, adornos cosmeticos y articulos de libreria que ofrece a los vecinos del lugar brindandoles la oportunidad de conseguir lo que necesitan sin tener que trasladarse al área mas comercial, lo que les demanda mucho tiempo, pues el autobus no pasa con frecuencia.
Al acercarse la época navideña Teresita quiere abastecer su local con artículos que sean de conveniencia para sus vecinos y clientes, y es por eso que  ha acudido a buscar un nuevo  crédito en procura de aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos en esta navidad que se avecina.
texts.en:
Teresita lives in a beautiful place in Costa Rica called las Nubes de Coronado. Her home is typical of the rural Costa Rican area, and she lives here with one of her brothers.  A few years ago, she left the job that she had and decided to open a business in one of the rooms of her house. Here she has all type of gifts, cosmetics, and stationary items which she offers to neighbors, providing them with the opportunity to obtain what they need without traveling to a more commercial area. This trip takes a good deal of time since the bus does not run frequently.

As the Christmas season approaches, Teresita would like to stock her store with items that will be of interest to her neighbors and customers. For this reason, she has requested a new loan in hopes of increasing her sales, and in turn, her income during the approaching Christmas season.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as clothing, cleaners and books

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 27 años esposa de Moisés, de 30 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 03 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Isabel, es una mujer con muchas responsabilidades que cumplir por ello desde muy temprano se despierta para atender a sus hijos y enviarlos a la escuela; después se dirige a su centro de trabajo y abrir las puertas de su negocio en espera de sus primero consumidores. Desde hace 02 meses empezó a dedicarse en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, conservas y entre otros productos. Se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, por que gracias a ello, puede dedicarse a sus hijos. Con el apoyo del crédito comprará más productos para su negocio y así abastecer su tienda. Este será su préstamo número 01 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño crédito para que pueda cumplir con su objetivo. En su banco comunal agradece por darle la oportunidad de trabajar juntos responsablemente. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando productos para incrementar su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 27 years old and the wife of Moisés, age 30. They live in their own home with their three children, the reason behind her efforts. Isabel is a woman with many responsibilities to fulfill. For this reason, she wakes up very early so that she can attend to her children and send them off to school. Afterwards, she heads to her workplace so that she can open the doors of her business in anticipation of her first customers. Two months ago, she began selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, preserves, and other products. She is very pleased with her work. Thanks to her business, Isabel is able dedicate herself to her children. With the help of this loan, she will buy more products for her business and be able to restock her store.

This will be her first loan with MFP. Isabel hopes that this small loan will enable her to achieve her goal. In her Communal Bank, she is grateful to be given the opportunity to work responsibly as part of a group. With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of products to expand her store such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, preserves, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, preserves, and other products.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”RICCHARY CUSCO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yobanna;  La socia tiene 28 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 10 meses; La socia trabaja en el centro comercial el Altiplano, ella se encarga de vender postres, la socia compra ingredientes y preparara, tortas, kekes, gelatinas, flanes, pudin, y desea comprar una vitrina, la socia desea en esta ocasión comprar una vitrina para exhibir los postres y comprar insumos para la elaboración de todos sus deliciosos postres y gelatinas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Yobana is a member of the Communal Bank “Ricchary Cusco” which is located in the District of Huanchac in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 4 and 10 months). Yobana works at a shopping center in Altiplano where she sells desserts. She buys ingredients and prepares cakes, cupcakes, gelatins, flan, and pudding. Yobana also wants to buy a display case. On this occasion, she wants to buy a display case in order to showcase her desserts. She will also buy supplies for making all of her delicious desserts and gelatins.

Yobana is grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy a display case and ingredients for making desserts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to put up a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials, labor, and transportation costs associated with her home improvements.

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Hermila; ella es casada y tiene 69 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artesanía, ella hace trabajos como muñecas y llaveros y luego lo distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden artesanía en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, tela e hilos para hacer los llaveros y muñecas.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de taller de mecánica, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de encomiendas, negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

Todos los socios continúan en el banco comunal Kusikoyllor, nadie se retiro a todos les fue muy bien en sus diversos negocios que realizaron.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Hermila is 69 years old, married, and has four children. She works in her business of selling handicrafts. The products she makes, such as dolls and key rings, are distributed to different stores that sell handicrafts in the city of Cusco. Hermila works from 8am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward. Hermila wants to expand her handicraft business, so she is requesting a loan to buy materials such as wool, fabric, and thread for making key rings and dolls.

The other members engage in businesses such as restaurants, auto repair shops, grocery stores, selling food, and selling beauty products. They all continue with the Communal Bank “Kusikoyllor”. No one has left the group since they have all done well in their different businesses.

Hermila is grateful to everyone who has helped her to fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy craft materials such as wool, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El socio sigue con su negocio inicial y sigue viajando constantemente a ún bello Distrito en la provincia de Quispicanhis donde aún se conserva el folklore tipico y oriundo de la zona, al igual que su modo de vida ancestral, el socio cuida de su cultivo de maíz y en esta ocasión el socio deshierbara su terreno de cultivo y tambien apoyara a su mamá en la mobilidad escolar, el socio desea invertir en la compra de abono y para el pago para deshierbar su terreno de cultivo de maíz y apoyar a su mama con la mobilidad.
texts.en:
This client continues with the business he started and still travels constantly to the beautiful district of Quiquijana, where native traditional folklore and ancient methods of living are kept alive.  The member takes care of his crop of corn.  On this occasion, he is removing weeds from his farmland and also helping his mother who drives a school vehicle.  

The member wants to invest in the purchase of compost and to pay someone to remove weeds from his cornfield.  He will also help his mother with her vehicle.

loans.use: to buy compost, pay for labor to remove weeds, and cover the costs related to his mother's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her child's university courses and degree requirements.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 42 años; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Teodosia, de 35 años y fruto de ese amor tienen 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 13 años que Juan se dedica a la venta de libros, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable. Juan se despierta muy temprano para luego dirigirse a su librería en espera de sus primeros clientes; entre ellos los escolares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trabajar tranquilamente; con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar más libros para abastecer su librería. Este será su préstamo número 07 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos de trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá comprando más libros para incrementar su librería como: libros de fábulas, cuentos, obras, diccionarios, etc.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Teodosia, age 35. They have three beloved children for whom they try to provide a better quality of life. Juan has been selling books for 13 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man.

Juan wakes up very early so that he can open his bookstore in anticipation of his first customers, most of whom are in school. What he enjoys most about his job is being able to work in peace. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more books to restock his store.

This will be his seventh loan with MFP. He waits for assistance so that he can continue with his work objectives. This loan of 3000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of more books to expand his store such as fable collections, tales, literary works, dictionaries, and other genres.

loans.use: to buy books such as fables, tales, literary works, and dictionaries.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Rosario

texts.es:
Guadalupe, una señora de 56 años sencilla, humilde, risueña y muy trabajadora madre soltera de 5 hijos, ella se dedica a uno de los oficios más comunes pero productivos dentro del comercio de la ciudad de León, como lo son las tortillerías. Aunque ella es originaria de Masatepe, Carazo  lleva 37 años de vivir en León. Ella lamenta mucho el no haber podido estudiar pues sus padres no tenían recursos económicos y tuvo que empezar a trabajar desde muy joven incluso emigrar a otra ciudades que no era la suya en busca de un mejor nivel de vida, trabajo durante mucho tiempo como domestica pero a los 47 años de edad fue que decidió poner su negocio de tortillería con una lata vieja, 2 rajas de leña y una libra de maíz empezó su humilde negocio. Hoy en día lleva 9 años trabajando en su tortillería que elabora y vende dentro de su vecindario las mayoría de sus clientes son amas de casa que desde tempranas horas esperan que abra su negocio para desayunar esas calientitas y recién hechas tortillas con maíz. 
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar maíz, leña, cal y frijoles, pues son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar y vender sus apetecidas tortillas . Uno de sus planes es ir mejorando poco a poco su casa y la cocina donde elabora las tortillas y venta de frijoles cosidos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is an unassuming 56 year-old woman who is humble, cheerful and hardworking.  She is the single mother of 5 children, and she works in one of the most common but productive trades in the city of Leon - as a tortilla-maker.  Although she is a native of Masatepe, Carazo, she has been living in Leon for 37 years.  She regrets very much that she was not able to get an education, but her parents did not have economic resources and she had to start working when she was very young.  She also migrated to cities other than her own in search of a better standard of living. She worked very hard for a long time as a domestic, but at age 47 she decided to start her own tortilla business. With an old tin pan, 2 bundles of firewood and a pound of corn, she started her humble business.  Now she has been working in her tortilla business for 8 years; she makes the tortillas and sells them in her neighborhood. Most of her customers are housewives who, from the early hours, await the opening of her business so that they can have her warm and recently made corn tortillas for breakfast.

Guadalupe is taking this loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and beans.  These are the raw materials that she uses to make and sell her delicious tortillas.  One of her plans is to gradually make improvements to her house and to the kitchen where she makes the tortillas and cooked beans that she sells.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to renovate the roof of her house.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
En Chacaraseca una comarca localizada en el ara rural de la ciudad de León, vive Cándida una mujer luchadora, dinámica y proactiva que le gusta salir adelante muy a pesar de no ser una mujer con estudios profesionales ha sabido desarrollarse en el comercio, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, siembra y tiene una mini pulpería que s de mucha ayuda en su comarca donde no son muy comunes las pulperías. Además es madre y padre de sus 4 hijos que junto con ella han salido adelante con lo poco que han logrado obtener. Comenzó a criar cerdos a los 16 años de edad, este fue su primer negocio después se fue a sembrar yuca, ajonjolí, maíz, frijoles y posteriormente ha ido invirtiendo en su mini pulpería. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de cerdos de crianza. Pues el crédito le ayudara en adquirir cerdos de raza para crianza donde el peso y la reproducción son dos parámetros muy importantes para sus clientes. Una de sus expectativas es tener una granja de cerdos reproductores y hacer crecer su pulpería para ofrecer  variedad productos  de mucha necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Cándida lives in Chacaraseca, a region located in the rural area of León.  She is a dynamic and proactive woman, a fighter who likes to get ahead.  Very much in spite of not being a woman who studied a profession, she has learned how to develop herself in business.

She works raising pigs and planting, and she has a mini- grocery store that is a big help in her region where grocery stores are not very common.  She also is mother and father to her four children who, together with her, have gotten ahead with the little they have managed to get.  She began raising pigs when she was 16 years old.  That was her first business; later she began to grow yucca, sesame, corn, and beans, and subsequently she has been investing in her mini-grocery store.

She needs the loan to buy pigs to raise.  The loan will help her acquire pigs for raising, since weight and reproduction are two very important parameters for her customers.  One of her expectations is to have a farm of pigs for reproducing and make her grocery store grow to offer a variety of products of great necessity in her community.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor needed for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stone, cement, iron, sand, and tiles.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora lucia cuenta con 32 años de edad, está casada con el señor Ulises quien es campesino, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales todos estudian, el mayor cursa tercer año de prepa, 2 más primero y segundo año de secundaria y tercero y quinto año de primaria, tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva un año y medio.
Dice que inicio con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y mejorar un poco su economía, para poder gozar de una muy buena calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercancía como son: huevos, frijoles, refrescos, leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, etc. Para así tener un mejor surtido.
Ella está convencida que uno de sus más grandes sueños se podrá cumplir, ya que es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local más amplio, para poner una abarrotería y así tenerlo bien surtido, con una amplia variedad de productos, para así incrementar y mejorar sus ingresos.
Doña lucí (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) dice que está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, pero sobre todo por la confianza.
texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years old. She married to Ulises who is a farm worker. They have five school-age children. The oldest is in the third year of preparatory school. The next two are in their first and second year of secondary school. The youngest children are in their third and fifth years of primary school. Lucia has had a grocery store for a year and a half.
She says that she started this small business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband with the household expenses and to improve their economic situation in order to enjoy a good quality of life. The loan that she received was invested in the purchase of more merchandise like eggs, beans, soft drinks, milk, oil, rice, sugar, etc. This merchandise will give her a better selection. 
She is convinced that one her biggest dreams that she will be able to achieve is to make her business grow a lot more. She wants to build a larger building for her grocery store in order to have a good selection and greater variety of products. With this plan, she can increase and improve her profits.
 Lucí (how she is known in her community) says that she is very grateful for the kiva lenders, for the support that they are offering and more than anything for the confidence.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of more merchandise like eggs, beans, soft drinks, milk, oil, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora rosario es una mujer joven pero muy emprendedora, cuenta con 19 años de edad y está casada con el señor Reynaldo quien es campesino tienen un pequeño hijo, que se llama ángel apenas tiene 1 año de edad, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva  apenas 1 año.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa y para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, huevos, refrescos, agua, galletas, azúcar, frijol, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. para así tener un poco más surtido su negocio.
Doña rosa (así es como le dicen en su familia) dice que uno de los sueños que tiene, es el de hacer crecer aun mas su pequeño negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner su tienda y así tener un amplio surtido y variedad de productos, puesto que así obtendrá mejores ingresos, para poder asegurar la educación de su hijo.
Está muy contenta por esta gran ayuda que FRAC y los prestatarios de kiva le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso, ahora gozara de un mejor nivel de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario is a young woman, but she is very enterprising.  She is 19 years old and married to Reynaldo, who is a farmer.  They have a young son named Angel, who is just one year old.  She has had a small grocery store for about one year.

She said that she decided to start this small business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses and to give her son a better quality of life.  She will invest this loan in more merchandise, such as milk, eggs, sodas, water, cookies, sugar, beans, toilet paper, soap, and other items so that her store will be well stocked.

Rosa (as she is called by her family) says that one of her dreams is to grow her business.  She would like to have a shop to put her store and have it well stocked with a variety of products so that she can earn a better income and ensure that her son will get a good education.

She is very happy with the help that FRAC and Kiva lenders have given her and thanks to that help, she will enjoy a better quality of life and a good business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as milk, eggs, sodas, water, cookies, sugar, beans, toilet paper, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela cuenta con 33 años de edad y está casada con el señor Roberto con quien tiene 2 hijos, Alexis y marco Antonio quienes están cursando tercer año de secundaria y sexto año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 2 años.
Dice que se animo a iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, para mejorar su calidad de vida, apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y hacerse de una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: aceite, pastas para sopa, arroz, refrescos, leche, galletas, focos, jabón, clarasol, etc. para tener un mejor surtido. 
Una de las metas que dice tener doña Carmen (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio, es la de invertirle mucho mas, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere ampliar un poco mas su pequeño local y poner su abarrotería, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ganancias, también empezar a ahorrar parte de las mismas, para asegurar su futuro junto al de su familia.
Doña carmen está muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por todo el apoyo y sobre todo confianza que le están brindando.
texts.en:
Carmela is 33 years old and married to Roberto.  They have two children, Alexis and Marco Antonio, who are in their third year of high school and sixth year of primary school.  She has had a grocery store for two years.

She says that she started this business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses, improve her quality of life, support her children with their studies, and become more solvent.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise such as oil, pastas for soup, rice, drinks, milk, cookies, light bulbs, soap, and other items to have a better sock.

Carmen (as she is better known in her community) says that one of her goals for her business is to invest in it much more to make it grow quickly.  She wants to expand her small space and open a real grocery store so that she can earn a better income.  She is also starting to save part of her income to assure her family's future.

Carmen is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all of their support and the confidence they have in her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as oil, pastas for soup, rice, drinks, milk, cookies, light bulbs, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Basilisia Maricela

texts.es:
La señora Basilisa maricela cuenta con 45 años de edad y está casada con el señor Genaro con quien tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 estudian Abelardo y Carlos, cursan tercer año de prepa y sexto año de primaria, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, se dedica a la venta de agua en garrafón desde hace mas de 5 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, y así ofrecerles una muy buena calidad de vida, también contar con una mejor solvencia económica, para apoyarlos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más botes de agua y refrescos.
La meta que tiene doña Basilisa es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que lo que en verdad quiere es construir un pequeño local para poner un deposito de refrescos, y así tener más variedad y surtido, ya que podrá mejorar sus ingresos, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios profesionales.
“Le doy las gracias a Fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva, por confiar en mí y brindarme todo su apoyo”.
texts.en:
Basilisia Maricela is 45, and married to Genaro.  They have 4 children: Abelardo and Carlos are in the 3rd year of high school and sixth year of primary school while the other two are married.  
She has sold large bottles of water for more than 5 years.  She tells us that she decided to begin since she wanted a way to get her children ahead and offer them a good quality of life.  She also wanted to have more income to support them with their studies.  She will us the loan to buy more bottles of water and soft drinks.

Basilisia’s goal is to have her business grow and what she really wants is to build a small stand from where she can sell soft drinks.  She could then have more variety and supply and improve her earnings and continue supporting her children in their professional studies.
“I thank the Foundation Realided and the Kiva donors for having confidence in me and offering me their support”.

loans.use: to buy more bottles of water and soft drinks

loans.name: Enedelia

texts.es:
Doña enedilia tiene 49 años de edad y está casada con el señor Inocencio muñoz quien es campesino, tienen 7 hijos de los cuales solo  Alberto, miguel, Gerardo, Alicia y consuelo estudian, el mayor cursa el segundo año de la carrera en derecho, dos más segundo y tercer año de prepa,  segundo y tercer año de secundaria, ya que los otros 2 están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos enteros y destazados (por piezas) desde hacen más de 2 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque está buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, aparte de que este negocio genera muy buenas ganancias, también porque quiere continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, el crédito que recibió lo va a utilizar, para comprar más pollos y alimento para terminar de criarlos y así continuar con sus ventas.
Ella dice que la meta más importante que tiene y quiere lograr, es la de construir un pequeño corral, ya que quiere poner una granja de pollos, para así ya no tener que comprarlos, ya que esto le servirá para mejorar un poco mas sus ingresos y ahorrar una parte para continuar apoyando a su hijos con sus estudios y puedan tener una muy buena profesional.   
Doña delia (como la conocen en su comunidad) está muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y Fundación realidad, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que ahora va a contar con un mejor negocio.
texts.en:
Enedilia, 49, and married to Inocencio Muñoz, who is a farmer. They have seven children. Alberto, Miguel, Gerardo, Alicia and Consuelo are in school.  The oldest is in the second year of law school, two are in second and third year of high school, and the younger two are in the second and third year of junior high school. Her other two children are married.

She has been selling whole chickens and cut-up chicken for more than two years.  She says that she decided to start this business, because she was looking for a way of helping her husband with the household expenses, besides the fact that this business generates very good earnings, and also because she wants to continue supporting her children with their education. 

She is going to use the loan she received to buy more chickens and feed for raising them, so that she can continue selling them. 

She says that the most important goal she has, and wants to achieve, is that of building a small farmyard, as she wants to set up a chicken farm, so that she doesn't have to buy them. This will enable her to improve her income a little bit more, and save part of it, so that she can continue supporting her children's education, so that they can have very good professions. 

Delia, as they know her in the community is very thankful for the Kiva lenders and Fundación Realidad, for all the support and trust they have provided her, as now she is going to have a better business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed for raising them.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia cuenta con 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Arnulfo quien es campesino, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales solo enrique y Eduardo estudian, cursan primer año de prepa y segundo año de secundaria ya que el mayor está casado, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos, desde hace mas de 3 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y contar con una solvencia económica más estable, y así poder vivir cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como son: leche, sal y cuajo. 
El sueño más grande que tiene doña Basilia es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y ampliarlo, para así tener una mejor producción y surtido puesto que así incrementara un poco mas sus ganancias. 
Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatarios de kiva, por toda la ayuda y la confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilia 42, is married to Arnulfo, who is a farmer. They have three children. Only Enrique and Eduardo are in school; one in first year of high school, and the other in the second year of junior high school. Their eldest son is married. 

She has been making and selling cheese for three years. She says that she started this business, as she wanted to help her husband with the expenses for the household and their children's education. She also wanted to improve her standard of living a bit, have more financial stability, and so be able to live comfortably.  

She is going to use the loan she received to buy more ingredients, such as milk, salt, and curds. Basilia's greatest dream is to make her business grow even more, and expand it. This way she can have better production and selection, and in this way increase her earnings a bit more. 

She is very thankful to Fundación Realidad and to the Kiva lenders for all the help they are providing, and for their trust in her. Thanks to the support she has received, her life has changed a lot, and so has her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as milk, salt, and curds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La Socia se dedica aún a brindar el servicio de mobilidad escolar con su propia combi y la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de repuestos para la combi y mantenimiento de la misma, La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos de carro.
texts.en: The member still provides school transportation with her own minivan. On the is occasion, the member wishes to use the loan in order to buy spare parts for her minivan, and to maintain it. She is applying for the loan to buy spare parts, and to maintain her vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, and maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La señorita Adelina es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora que le gusta mucho el trabajo que tiene, cuenta con la edad de 23 años y es soltera, es la menor de 4 hermanos y quien cuida a su mamá, tiene una taquería con la cual lleva apenas 1 año.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad, porque quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia también, para tener una buena solvencia económica, y así empezar a ahorrar y asegurar el futuro de su madre ya que es de edad avanzada, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos como: chiles, tomates, cilantro, cebollas, rábanos, tortillas, gas, carne, aceite y sal, para continuar con la elaboración de sus ricos tacos. 
Una de las metas que tiene ade (así es como le dicen en su casa), es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, mucho más grande, comprar más sillas y mesas, para poder mejorar e incrementar sus ventas junto con sus ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esa ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Adelina is a very hard-working and enterprising young woman.  She really likes the work that she has.  She is 23 years old and single.  She is the youngest of four siblings, and she takes care of her mother.  She has had a taco stand for barely a year.

She says that she started this business activity because she wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family as well.  She wants to be financially solvent and start to save in order to secure her elderly mother’s future.

She will use the loan that she received to buy supplies like chilies, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, radishes, tortillas, gas, meat, oil, and salt in order to continue making her delicious tacos.

One of the goals that Ade (as she is called at home) has is to make her business grow a lot.  She wants to build a much bigger place.  She will buy more chairs and tables in order to be able to increase her sales along with her income.

She is very grateful to FRAC and the Kiva lenders for this great support they are offering her.  Thanks to this help her business and her family life have  changed quite a bit.

loans.use: to buy supplies like chilies, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, radishes, tortillas, gas, meat, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela cuenta con 29 años de edad y está casada con el señor Juan López con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo Roberto y azucena estudian, están cursando tercer año de primaria y tercer año de preescolar, ya que el más pequeño apenas tiene 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos enteros y por pieza desde hace 1 año.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quería independizarse un poco y ganar su propio dinero, también para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos, también para contar con una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos y alimento para criarlos.
Doña  Ángela tiene una meta es la de construir un local, para poner su pollería, ya que así podrá tenerlo muy bien surtido y contar con una mejor producción y atención a su clientes, ya que así mejorara e incrementara aun mas sus ganancias, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el gran apoyo que les están aportando, puesto que con esa ayuda va a mejorar su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela is 29 years old. She is married to Juan López and they have three children. Roberto and azucena are in school. One is in the third year of primary school and the other is in the third year of preschool. The youngest one is two years old.  Ángela has sold whole chickens and chicken parts for one year.
She says that she decided to invest in this business because she would like gain some independence and earn her own money. She also started this to help her husband with the household expenses and to help her children. The business also helps her to have greater economic solvency and quality of life. The loan she received was invested in the purchase of more chickens and food for raising the chickens. 
Ángela has a goal of building a place for her poultry store since she has a good selection and she counts on having a larger production and better customer service. This will improve and increase her earnings in order to secure the future of her children and allow them to have good professional careers. 
She gives thanks to the fundación realidad for the great support that the organization provides. With this help, she will improve her business and the lives of her family members.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of more chickens and food for the chickens.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora josefina tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera aun no tiene hijos es una persona muy responsable y dice le gusta mucho la actividad que realiza,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de manteles y servilletas desde hace mas de 2 años, ya que es una artesanía típica de su comunidad.
Dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, por la falta de oportunidades de trabajo, también para apoyar a su familia y gozar de un mejor nivel de vida, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: hilos al mayoreo, telas y manta.
Una de las metas que tiene José (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad), es la de hacer crecer aun más el negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de ropa típica, tenerla muy bien surtida y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.
Estoy muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y la empresa, por todo el apoyo y confianza que me están brindando,  ya que gracias a esta ayuda contamos con un mejor negocio y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina is 23 years old, single, with no children yet. She is a very responsible person who says she greatly enjoys her business. She has made  tablecloths and napkins for more than 2 years, as this is a very common crafting activity in her community.

She says she started this small business due to the lack of job opportunities, and to support her family and improve their quality of life.

She will use the loan she received to invest in buying more goods, such as wholesale sewing threads, fabrics and manta (cotton woven).

One of José's (as she is best known by her community) goals is to make her business grow even more, since she plans to build a shop to set up her business of selling typical clothes. She wants to have enough clothes for her business in order to improve and increase her income.

"I am so grateful to Kiva's lenders and to the institution for their support and trust, because thanks to their help, we have a better business and a better quality of life," she says.

loans.use: To invest in buying more goods, such as wholesale sewing threads, fabrics and manta (cotton woven).

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía cuenta con 22 años de edad y está casada con el señor mariano, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Alejandro, José y Alondra, los cuales cursan primer año de primaria y los dos menores primer y segundo año de preescolar, se dedica a la elaboración de manteles servilletas y huipiles, desde hace 1 año.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar en algo a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, también para así gozar de una muy buena economía, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como son: hilos al mayoreo, telas, y mantas.
Uno de los sueños que tiene doña Sofía es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, y brindar un excelente servicio, para así contar con un  mayor número de clientes, y hacerse de más y mejores ingresos.
Dice que este es el mejor apoyo que habían podido darle, ya que gracias  a esto, ahora goza de una mejor calidad de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Sofía, 22, is married to Mariano and they have three children: Alejandro, José and Alondra.  They attend first grade and first and second grade of preschool.  She has been making tablecloths, napkins and huipiles [traditional blouses] for a year.


She says that she decided to start this activity because she wanted to find a way to help her husband a bit and to help with her children’s schooling so that they can have a better future and also to enjoy a better economy.  The loan she received will be used to buy more materials like: thread at wholesale, fabric and unbleached cotton. 


One of Sofía’s dreams is to make her business grow more and to provide excellent service so that she can have a larger number of customers and earn more and better income.  She says that this is the best possible support she could have gotten and thanks to it she now enjoys a better quality of life and a good business.

loans.use: to buy more material like thread at wholesale, fabirc and unbleached cotton.

loans.name: Doña Amelia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Doña Amelia sus integrantes decidieron ponerle así  por que se indefinan con  su grupo .
Este grupo  esta conformado por  diez integrantes  con deseos de superarse día  día ya que gracias a dios todos cuentan con un pequeño negocio.
La integrante de este grupo es la señora Amelia  quien se dedica a la venta de carne desde hace treinta años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio  es matar la res y tasajear la carne .
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Roberto quien la apoya y también se dedica a la venta de carne.
Doña Ame como le dicen las personas de su localidad es una señora trabajadora humilde y lechona  ya que cuando no tiene venta en su localidad va a vender a vender a pueblos vecinos.
Tiene  un hijo quien le ayuda a matar la res y a atender a los clientes.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  cuchillo,mesa,tabla para  tasajear.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Teofila-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
María-se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Constancia-se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Elías-se dedica a la venta de pan.
Alma- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Amelia- se dedica a la venta de carne.
Josellesica- quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Silvia- quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Elodia- quien se dedica a la venta de quesos.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en la vida y seguir cumpliendo sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called “Doña Amelia.”  Its members decided to call it that because they identify with their group.  It has ten members who wish to improve day to day since each has their own business, thanks to God.  


The group member is Amelia who has been selling meat for thirty years.  She tells us that what she likes best about her work is slaughtering the beef and butchering the meat.  She is happily married to Roberto who supports her efforts and also sells meat.  Doña Ame, like people in her community call her, is a hardworking, humble, tenacious woman who goes out to neighboring towns to sell when sales drop in her own location.  She has a son who helps her kill the steers and helps her tend to customers.  She requested the loan to buy knives and a butcher’s block.


The other group members are:

Teofila-sells Mexican fast food snacks.
María-sells clothes.
Constancia-sells chickens.
Elías-sells bread.
Alma- sells Mexican fast food snacks.
Amelia- sells meat.
Josellesica- sells food.
Silvia- sells chickens.
Elodia- sells cheese.


She thanks the Fundación for the support it’s given her to get ahead and succeed in life and continue reaching her dreams.

loans.use: to buy knives and a butcher's block.

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeun, a 38-year-old woman residing in Pouk District, Siem Reap Province, is the mother of a child enrolled in a public primary school. To earn a living, Choeun has been making bamboo baskets and other containers from her home, a skill she learned from her parents, since 2000. She sells her products to tradesmen who send them to international marketplaces.

Choeun is requesting this loan to buy a used motorcycle for her husband, an outdoor worker, who often needs to use motor-taxi services. The savings in transport fares will help improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Mrs. Pum is 26 years old. She is a married woman with two young children and comes from Baray district, Cambodia. She is involved with the business of raising pigs in order to make her living. She earns additional income by providing a rice-husking service for the people who live in her area. 

Mrs. Pum has a life partner in her husband, who is dedicated to animal husbandry, primarily cattle. He buys and sells at commercial markets in the provinces. Mrs. Pum has asked for this loan to purchase additional cattle to support her husband’s business. In years to come she hopes to improve her standard of living as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Surya Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Florentina is pictured above holding the plate of pastels (Indonesian snack pastry filled with vegetables). She is 52 years old and married with three children. Her younger child is 15 years old and still at school. She has been selling pastels and other fried snacks since 2009. The business is running smoothly and she wants to add more variety of snacks to sell. That's why she needs a second loan from VisionFund Indonesia. The income she makes from this business, she uses to help her husband's income from being a masseur to fulfill the family's daily basic needs and to pay for her child's school fee. She likes to do this business because her hobby is cooking but sometimes she faces a challenge when she gets a big order and she doesn't have enough capital to fulfill the order.

In the future, she hopes she can have her own store and open another stall. She also hopes to always have enough savings to make her child finish school.

The other group members use their part of the loan to improve their businesses, which include selling vegetables, selling clothes and selling traditional herbal medicine.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make fried snacks

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is married and has a business buying and selling cellphones and home appliances in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Mercedita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Mrs. Hom, 29, is a humble person who lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She has been working in rice and pig husbandry since 2003. From these activities, she can make a profit of $4.00 per day to satisfy her family’s needs. 

Hom is now asking for a loan to buy additional breeds of pigs and feed to fatten her pigs. She has insufficient funds now so she hopes this loan will be granted to her to improve her micro-business and her family's lives as well.

loans.use: to buy additional breed of pigs and feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem is 46 years old and married with five children. Presently she lives with them and her husband in Kompong Speu province. She and her spouse have been involved in farming for almost 19 years. Together, they typically earn around $2.00 per day.

Yoem is currently asking for a microloan of $500 to buy a motorcycle so her family can have the best possible transportation service. She hopes that lenders will not reject her first loan request.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so her family has the best possible transportation service.

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.ru: Бунёд занимается в аграрном бизнесе более 7 лет. Он выращивает пшеницу и картофель. Еще он имеет комбайн, которым предоставляет услуги во время  сезона. В не сезонное время он занимается купле- продажей урожая. На полученную прибыль он хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Бунёд хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 12000 Сомони для покупки семян пшеницы и картофеля. Бунёд заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Bunyod has been a farmer for the last seven years. He grows wheat and potatoes. He also owns a combine which he rents out during the harvesting season. During the slow growing times he sells and resells produce. He wants to use the the profits from the resale to repair his house. Bunyod would really like to expand his farm business and be able to earn higher profits. He is taking out this loan of 12000 somoni to purchase wheat seeds and seed potatoes for planting. Bunyod is grateful in advance for your kindness and assistance.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat and potatoes

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru: Ихьтиёр активный и трудолюбивый человек. Он является фермером. Он начал свою работу семь лет назад, для того чтобы зарабатывать на свою жизнь и помогать своим родителям. В начале ему было трудно, а потом постепенно расширял свой бизнес. Он выращивает пшеницу и картофель, а также откармливает скот. Ихьтиёр хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия и хочет создать свою семью и жить счастливо. Ихьтиёр надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам, за то что позволили ему осуществить его мечту.
texts.en: Ikhtiyor is an active and hardworking man. He is a farmer. Ikhtiyor started his farming business seven years ago to make an independent living and be able to support his parents. At first it was hard to make ends met but he was able to slowly expand his business. Now he grows wheat and potatoes and also raises cattle for meat production. Ikhtiyor wants to further expand his farm and be able to earn enough profits to purchase a house, start his own family and find happiness. He is turning to your for help and want to thank everyone in advance for allowing him to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 23-year-old green grocery dealer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and has been in this business for the last three years. She is doing great in the business. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her second loan to expand her business. She plans to buy more kale, cabbages, spinach and tomatoes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business further and hopes to own her own grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more kale, cabbages, spinach and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio is 38 years old and is married to Violeta, the couple is thankful because they had been blessed with one child. Dionicio had been operating a motorcycle transport service in his village for five years. 

A profit generated from his business is just enough to cover their everyday expenditures for food and the monthly electric bill. He is facing financial difficulties at this moment so he needs additional capital. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy gasoline and for the maintenance of the motorcycle.
 
In the future, he wants to improve his services and acquire a good income to continuously operate the smooth flow of his operation.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 31 years old. He operates a barber shop in Majaoni, Mombasa. He is single and has been in this business for the past four years and is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his second loan to enable him expand his business. Christopher plans to buy more barber chairs and shaving machines. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and hopes to own another barber shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more barber chairs and shaving machines.

loans.name: Chester

texts.en:
Chester is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Pulay, Luna. He is a responsible son. He raises hogs in order to earn an income and lift his parents out of poverty. Chester usually raises hogs to fatten and breed. He has been doing this for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP for each hog.

Chester wants to improve his hog-selling business and is in need of additional capital. He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise and to buy feed for sustainability.

In the future, he would like to strengthen his small business and continuously earn profits from it.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a 62-year-old tailor in Tsangatsini, Mariakani. He is a married father of four children and has been in this business for the past 35 years. He is doing great.

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his third loan to finance his business. He plans to expand his business by purchasing more clothing materials. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children to eradicate poverty. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing more clothing materials.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a responsible mother of two children, who aims to become successful in the future. She is 32 years old and married. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to help her husband generate income to satisfy their family's needs. She has been in this business for almost seven years and usually earns profits of P8,000 for every two pigs she sells.

Cristina planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she didn't have enough capital, therefore, she is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She said that this loan will help her improve her business and she hopes that it make her business grow in future.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Cухроб живет вместе с женой и тремя детьми. Его мать также живут с ними.  Жена домохозяйка, а он сам кормит свою семью зарабатывая своим ремеслом. Он плотник. Он занимается производством и продажей окон и дверей. Он начал свою деятельность в 2008 году и вложил все свои силы и усилия. Раньше он продавал продукты питания. Он хочет получить займ и использовать целенаправленно. Он планирует использовать займ для покупки древесины на производство окон и дверей.
texts.en: Suhrob lives with his wife and three children. his elderly mother also lives with them. Suhrob's wife is a home maker, and he himself provides for the family with his woodworking business. Suhrob primarily makes doors and windows for sale. He started his woodworking business back in 2008 and put all of his money and strength in helping it take off. Before he was a woodworker Suhrob sold groceries. He is hoping to use this loan to purchase a large batch of wood whole sale so that he can make additional doors and windows for a better profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase of wood for windows and doors

loans.name: Mayuge Group

texts.en:
Winfrida is the facilitator of the Mayuge group. Winfrida and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Winfrida takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Winfrida had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Winfrida was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Winfrida and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Winfrida will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mayuge group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Winfrida is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 27-year-old motorbike (boda boda) operator in Tuskys, Kilifi. He is a married father of four children and has been in this business for the past eight months and is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first loan to expand his business. Thomas plans to buy another motorbike to increase his operations in the boda boda business and use the anticipated profits to boost his spouse in her tailoring business. 

His dream is to broaden his business to help him to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a responsible mother who is engaged in a hog-raising business. She is 47 years old and has two children. Editha is a widow. She lives with her children in the village of Pulay. She says that being a single parent is very difficult but still she works hard to give her children a better quality of life by doing something that brings her additional income. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over 5 years and has extensive experience in this business.

Editha dreams of lifting her children from poverty, and she also wants to provide the necessities for her hogs. Thus she wants to avail a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men is 32 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province. She is married with four single children. Some of her children are now working in various jobs, including a factory worker and a construction worker. She earns a living by cultivating rice crops along with her spouse. In the past few months, Men bought a plot of farmland from her neighbor to increase her rice fruit for more income, yet she has insufficient capital to pay for the land successfully. For this reason, she is now seeking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for her debt. Money from the loan makes it possible for her to sustain her business and living.

loans.use: to pay for a plot of farmland she bought from her neighbor.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 30-year-old business lady from Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a single lady who has been in the school business for the last three years. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD., and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase more textbooks for her school and use the anticipated profit to expand her school by building more classrooms for students. 

She hopes to see her school grow into a large educational institution.

loans.use: to purchase more textbooks for her school.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, where he has been doing mixed farming for four years. He is aged 34 and married with four children, three of whom are already attending school. His farm produces maize, milk and beans, which he sells to the local market.

Godrey has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this will improve his farming income and enable him to have milk for the family as well as to pay for the education of the children.

Godfrey notes animal diseases as the major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is 23 years old and single.  To earn a living, he does motorbike transport business.  He has been in the business for two years.  Besides, he practices dairy farming.  He has grown his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has helped him to improve his living standards.
Evanson has requested for a loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn, a 26-year-old mother of three children, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for two years. Working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family, she also sells street food in the village for additional income.

Mailyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy paint for her motorcycle and to buy raw ingredients for her street food business. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint for her motorcycle and to buy raw ingredients for her street food business.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a 33-year-old retail shop proprietor in Kamukunji, Mariakani.  She is married, and a mother of three children. She has been in this business for the past three years and she is doing great. 

This will be Zawadi’s second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to expand her business by purchasing more stock of cereals, sugar, cooking fat and soaps to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. In the future she hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of cereals, sugar, cooking fat and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is married to Edwin, who is a farmer in Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. They have one child. Ma. Luisa helps her husband transplant seedlings in the field. They have been growing rice as source of income. They usually earn P20,000 and use this for expenses at home, such as meals and electric bills.

According to her, cost of living nowadays is expensive due to the increasing prices of basic commodities.  She must increase her income in order to meet all their needs. She is now asking for additional capital of P20,000 because she lacks capital nowadays. She will buy UREA (fertilizer) and insecticide used in farming.

Ma. Luisa hopes to keep producing good harvests to improve their lives someday.

loans.use: to buy UREA (fertilizer) and insecticide for farming.

loans.name: Makale Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Makale Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Loice is the facilitator of the Makale Farmers group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Loice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Loice had a good maize yield harvesting four bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Loice was only able to harvest one bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Loice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Loice will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Makale Farmers group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Loice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en: Mailyn is a little entrepreneur who has been selling beauty products such as AVON cosmetics for more than two years now.
