With the minimal profits earned from the business she is able to provide daily allowances of her children. Mailyn is 32 years old. She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy more products to offer such as perfumes, lotion, makeup, powder and intimate apparel. She wants to increase her product offerings to make her business more profitable. In the future, Mailyn would like to see her children earn degrees and someday help to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to offer such as perfumes, lotion, makeup, powder and intimate apparel.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 37 years old, married, and a father of six children. He operates a motorbike transport business (known locally as boda boda) in Tezo, Kilifi.  He has been in this business for the last two months and he is doing great. 

This will be Samwel’s first loan from KADET LTD to expand his business. He plans to buy another motorcycle and use the anticipated profits to repay his loan.  He hopes to have an improved standard of living for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy another  motorcycle

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 47 years old, married, and a father of four children. He is a taxi operator and retail shop owner in Voi. He has been in business for the last two years. His businesses have been successful, and this will be his first loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to service his taxi cab to ensure that it is in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his retail shop business by purchasing more stock of flour, sugar, and cooking fat. He hopes to have a new taxi cab in the future, and to have a happy, satisfied family.

loans.use: to service his taxi cab to ensure that it is in good condition.

loans.name: Upendo Shg Group

texts.en:
Athman is the facilitator of the Upendo SHG group. Athman and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Athman doesn't take care of any children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Athman had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Athman was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Athman and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Athman will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan of 40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy timber.  He was able to make for furniture for resale.  With additional furniture in his workshop, he was able to attract more customers hence good sale. He is still practicing dairy farming to supplement his income
Samuel moved his business to a bigger business premise.  He has requested for 50, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a power saw.

loans.use: To buy a power saw

loans.name: Corner Nzuri Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Corner Nzuri Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Corner Nzuri group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Pamela will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Corner Nzuri group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Pamela with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tigidankay

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Tigidankay. She is married, and has four children, aged 22, 18, 15 and12 years. She has one additional dependent. 

In 2007, Tigidankay established her provisions and cosmetics business. She began her business because her husband's income was not sufficient to fully provide for the needs of their family, so her business is a source of additional income for their family. She opens her business seven days a week and seven hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones.Tigidankay  requires a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, sardines, coffee, tea and a variety of cosmetics for her business. In the future, Tigidankay plans to help her husband support their children’s university education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, sardines, coffee, tea and a variety of cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Ter

texts.en:
Mrs. Ter’s priority in life is to uplift her family’s living conditions. She is a single parent and has two single children who live together with her in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. 

She has to be involved in many businesses in order to maintain better living conditions and to pay for her daily expenses. There are three businesses she has been doing, such as cultivating rice crops, selling a kind of Khmer cake and trading rice from place to place. She is able to generate in the neighborhood of $4.00 from her farming business as well as the other two businesses. Moreover, her daughter helps to create income for the family by selling fruit from a rented booth in a local market of the province. 

Mrs. Ter would like to borrow this loan amount to buy stock of fruits and to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter’s business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
To alleviate poverty, Helen works hard to generate income. She is 43 years old and has three children. She engages in a food production business. She usually buys and sells eggs ("balut"). She has been in the business for almost 10 years, earning a net profit of 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. Her income goes to supporting the family's needs and toward the school fees of her children.

Helen wants to improve the business in order to increase her income so she can continuously send her children to school and save for future emergencies. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more eggs to sell in their village. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will help her earn a good income someday.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell in her village.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, a single mother of one child, lives in Mombasa, Kenya where she has operated a boutique for two years, a business she started from her own savings. Cecilia's challenges are a lack of capital and customers not paying on time.

Having leaned of Milango from her friends, she joined the group in order to access capital and is now requesting a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase more clothes. Cecilia will use the additional income arising from this loan to start a fish-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mukhungula Group

texts.en:
Zacharia is the facilitator of the Mukhungula group. Zacharia and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Zacharia takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Zacharia had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Zacharia was only able to harvest 4½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zacharia and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Zacharia will educate his children save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Mukhungula group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Zacharia is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Ma. Rochel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her sari sari store. Ma. Rochel has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Rochel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her sari sari store

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is married with 4 children. She is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nelma is a farmer and also produces copra (coconut) to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years and every month she earns 13,200 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for copra.

Nelma has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Nelma wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She owns a clothes business which has been in operation for 6 years. Her main challenges are inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers, and some of the customers not paying on time.

Mwanahawa is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase a bundle of used clothing for sale. She learned of Milango from her friends and joined in order to access credit. She will reinvest the income obtained from this business in order to improve its level of operations.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Huruma B Group

texts.en:
Alex is the facilitator of the Huruma B group. Alex and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alex takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alex had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alex was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alex and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Alex will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Huruma B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is married and has 3 school-going children. Simon owns a vehicle garage which has been in operation for the last 14 years. It is from this business that he has managed to provide an education to his children. 

Owing to increased daily demands, Simon joined Milango to access credit to boost the business and obtain higher incomes. He is applying for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase automobile parts and car accessories.

His ambition is to open a fully-fledged automobile garage that can offer all services including body work repairs. His main challenge is the high cost of most vehicle parts.

The extra income will help him educate his children and also open a new business to be run by his wife.

loans.use: to purchase automobile parts and car accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water tanks and cooking utensils for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair pieces, weaves and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en: Janeffer is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She does dairy farming to earn a living. She has been farming for two years. She also operates a retail shop to generate more income. She has improved her business through previous loans from Faulu Kenya that have helped improve her living standards. Janeffer hopes to become financially stable in the future. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, salt, and maize flour

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 33 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and married with one child.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Victoria has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Victoria aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 53 years old, married and has 6 children.  She earns a living by leasing farming equipment in the Philippines.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for farming equipment maintenance.

Amelita has been leasing farming equipment for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy spare parts to maintain farm equipment

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a farmer and a businessman running a mobile phone and money transfer business in the local market besides farming.  He is married and has one child aged 1, with himself being 22 years old. He has been in farming for 5 years, growing maize as the main produce for the local market.

Shadrack has requested for a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says the income generated will assist him in building a strong foundation for his family.  He hopes to make farming his source of livelihood and help him raise capital for a wholesale milk processing business.

Shadrack laments the high production costs and poor infrastructure.  He however appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Huruma A Group

texts.en:
George is the facilitator of the Huruma A group. George and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had a very good maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, George will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Huruma A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shima Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Shima Group in Western Kenya! Phanice is the facilitator of the Shima group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Phanice takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phanice had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phanice was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phanice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Phanice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Shima group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Phanice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Manini B Group

texts.en:
Alfayo is the facilitator of the Manini B group. Alfayo and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Alfayo takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alfayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfayo was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Alfayo will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Manini B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Alfayo with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lias

texts.en:
Lias, 51, is a married woman who resides in Reussey Keo, a suburb of Phnom Penh city. She lives there with her two single children and sells mixed products from a general store next to her house.  In her store, she sells many products such as sweet things, groceries, soft drinks, ice, snacks, canned foods and other household products, which yields a profit of $2.00 per day.   She also depends on her daughter’s income, who works in a coffee shop, to cover daily financial necessities.

Lias is asking for a loan amount of US$800 to purchase a motorcycle to give possible transport service for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store and sell more kinds of merchandise.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her family

loans.name: C9290 Abungukaneza Group

texts.en: Gilbert is 30 years old and single. He is also the leader of this group, which is called "C9290 Abungukaneza" in the local language. Gilbert employs two people to help him and has two years of experience. He works from 7AM until 7PM every day. Gilbert is the first person on the right in this picture. Gilbert has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more goods like beans, rice, soap, and cooking oil to sell. With his profits, Gilbert hopes to satisfy his customers and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, salt, beans, tomato sauce to sell.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio once worked abroad to seek for a greener pasture. He had worked as an OFW for two years which allowed him to save enough capital to invest in farming activities. Now he cultivates five hectares of corn fields that serve as his primary source of income. He grows corn and sells it upon harvest. He usually earns P35,000.

Cornelio is 44 years old and married having five children to educate. Two are in high school, one in elementary and one in college. 

He is now asking for a loan of P50,000 in order to improve his corn production. He will buy corn seeds,10 sacks of fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Cornelio would like to keep producing abundant harvest. Additional revenue from the business will be used to buy additional land to raise crops and someday raise the general living condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds,10 sacks of fertilizer and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Huruma C Group

texts.en:
Salome is the facilitator of the Huruma C group. Salome and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Salome takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Salome had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Salome was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Salome and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Salome will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Huruma C group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

Jacinta is a 32-year-old retail shop owner in Shanzu, Mombasa.  She is single and has been in the business for the past two years and is doing great.  

Jacinta was introduced to KADET and this marks her first borrowing to enable her to expand her business. She plans to purchase more stock of sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour, and use the anticipated profits to further expand her shop. Her dream in the future is to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy sugar, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en:
Dindo is a brave and painstaking man. He endures all hardships encountered in his life. It serves as a challenge for him to provide a good education for his three children whom are still in elementary grade. Aside from corn farming, he also serves his community as a Barangay Council at Estefania. In farming, he pours out all his experiences and farming practices. He has been in this field for five years. He plants and harvest corn upon maturity and his wife budgets it well for all his family's daily consumption. According to him, it was just enough to cover all their expenses. 

Dindo now lacks capital to buy corn seeds and fertilizers so he decided to borrow loan of P25,000 to buy his inputs. 

Someday, Dindo aims to earn a consistent profit from his corn farming business and lift his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and the fertilizers he uses in farming.

loans.name: Sop Mame Rokhaya Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 28 mars 2008. IL est composé de 11 membres issus du même Quartier.

Coumba (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupement, elle est veuve est âgée de 41 ans et à en charge  05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de ce type d'activité pour l'avoir exercée depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en légumes. 

Son objectif est d'élargir son commerce et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Rokhaya group was created on the 28th of March, 2008. It is made up of 11 members who all live in the same area.

Coumba, standing on the right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 41 years old, widowed and is raising 5 children. She is an experienced saleswoman who has been selling vegetables for several years. She will use the loan to restock on vegetables so that she can better satisfy her customer demand.

Coumba would like to expand her business and increase her profits, so that she is able to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roseline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. With income from maize sales, Roseline will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante lives in Estefania together with Felymar, his wife who takes care of their three children. Two of his children have settled into marriage, but sometimes they still rely on Dante and Felymar for their expenses. Dante is a loving father, so he is still earning an income at the age of 62. He owns a 1.5-hectare corn field and grows corn to sell.

He wants to improve his corn production and requires additional capital for inputs. He decided to borrow a loan amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Dante would like to have stable profits to use when emergency arises, as he and his wife are getting old and weak.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Maruni Group

texts.en:

Liru takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Liru had a very good maize yield harvesting 7½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Liru was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Liru  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

In 2012, the members of Maruni group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Hiru is pictured with his group members.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better equipment and stationery that he reckons will enhance his graphic art pieces.

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Maryrose is 51 years old and has only finished high school. She uses her strength and patience to provide a good future for her family. Though her family suffers poverty, Maryrose and her husband still raise crops because this is their only source of living. They had been growing corn for 15 years. They aim to improve their output because the cost of living nowadays is very expensive, especially tuition fees. Maryrose educates five children. 

She is now asking for P20,000 to buy five liters of insecticide and pesticide that will help crops grow productively. If so, she will increase her profits and someday upgrade their living condition.

loans.use: to buy five liters of insecticide and pesticide

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гульчехра женщина в возрасте 39 лет, замужем, имеет одну маленькую приёмную дочь. Из-за того, что она не смогла иметь детей, была вынуждена взять грудную девочку из детдома. Она счастлива, за то что бог ей дал такую возможность воспитывать лапочку дочку, ей сейчас уже три годика. Её муж мастер по ремонту автомашин. Сама Гульчехра имеет около дома свой продуктовый магазинчик, на который она берет каждый свой кредит и постепенно расширяет ассортимент продуктов. Кредитуется она с 2004 года, и ни разу не нарушала условия организации. На полученный кредит она хочет под новый год увеличить ассортимент шоколадных конфет.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a 39 year-old woman, who is married and has one little adopted daughter.  Because she could not have children of her own, she had to adopt an infant girl from an orphanage.  Gulchehra is happy that God gave her such an opportunity to raise a precious daughter, who is now three years old.  Gulchehra's husband is an auto mechanic.  Gulchehra owns a food store near her house and obtains each one of her loans for this store and gradually expands an assortment of products.  She has been obtaining financing since 2004 and has not once violated the terms of our organization.  She wants to use this loan to expand the selection of chocolate candy prior to the New Year's.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of products

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 37-year-old married woman and  mother of three children.  She works from her house so she can look after and take good care of her children.

Farah is a clever and talented tailor who works hard to fulfill her family’s needs.  She always dreams of opening her own clothing factory in the future to help in supporting her family’s social and financial situations.  That’s why she is making a small step forward through requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated sewing machine to improve her business.  In addition to that, Farah will try hard to buy a refrigerator necessary for her house because she doesn’t have one at this time.  She also seeks to improve her house through buying more comfortable and modern furniture.

Farah has been Al Majmoua's borrower for three consecutive cycles.  She is a borrower in good standing.   She is a hard worker and a great mother.  Success and improvement are the best ways to satisfy her family’s needs, and she can surely achieve this through good loan investments.

loans.use: by a sewing machine

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is taking another Kiva loan of KES 85,000 to boost her clothes business as she anticipates an increase in demand during the Christmas season. With this loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. The previous loan had a great impact in her business as she realized high profit earnings and was able to provide basic needs to her family.  She thanks Kiva lenders and Yehu for providing her with financial services to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a 40-year-old food kiosk owner in Barsheba, Mombasa.  She is a married mother of nine children, who has been in business for the last ten years and is doing great. 

Mishi was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. She plans to renovate her food kiosk and purchase more maize flour for her stock.   She will use the anticipated profit to expand her kiosk further to enable her to accommodate more clients.   She hopes to prosper and have a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: renovate her food kiosk and purchase more maize flour

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi, 28, is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 50,000, Bibi wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize flour, groundnut, fresh fruits, green vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, 22, is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past three years, Damaris has operated a poultry raising business, selling at the butcher shop to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Damaris dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Damaris wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 46-year-old married man and father of three children. He is known by his hard work in providing his family with a secure and healthy living.

Hassan owns a bakery specializing in Saj bread, a traditional Lebanese bread similar to pita bread. It’s a hard job for a man his age, but despite this he is still an ambitious man looking to expand and develop his business.   That’s why he decided to renovate his shop and buy a new modern and updated machine, in addition to making decorations to attract new customers.  These changes will be done through the requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Hassan is well-known in the region for his tasty specialty bread, in addition to his low prices and neat production. He aspires to expand his business with the help of the applied for loan, and he’s sure that it will improve his social and economic life.

loans.use: make improvements to his bakery

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze, 30, is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the electricity bill. 

Mbodze operates a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge is competition from other retail shop operators.  In the future, she would like to access bigger loans to boost her business.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000,  Mbodze wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjelina is taking another Kiva loan of KES 35,000 to boost her poultry business. With this loan, she wants to purchase poultry chicks, feed and medicine.   Anjelina dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's needs and improve their living standards.  She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to access funds for her business.

loans.use: buy chicks, chicken feed and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy another quarry site
